loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as rice and red oil, to sell.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 77 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres creían que el trabajo era mas importante en aquellos tiempos, está casada y es madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, de los cuales una hija aun vive en su casa, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura y de jornalero en la comunidad.


Paula se dedica a la crianza y engorde de ganado y aves, trabajos que le enseñaron sus padres desde pequeña, también trabaja junto a su esposo en la agricultura, tienen  una milpa en las lomas de los cerros para el cual tiene que caminar media hora para llegar al lugar. 


Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar dos novillas, además necesita invertir en la preparación de la tierra y compra de insumos como fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos. 

Su sueño es instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paula is 77 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study since her parents believed that work was more important at the time. Paula is married and the mother of four grown children. One daughter still lives at home. Her husband works in agriculture and is also a day laborer in their community.

Paula raises and fattens livestock and poultry. Her parents taught her these skills when she was a child. She also works with her husband in handling the farm duties. They have a cornfield on the side of a hill, which requires a 30-minute walk to get there.

This loan will be used to buy two heifers. She will also invest in the preparation of her land and purchase supplies, such as fertilizers and compost for her crops. Her dream is to have electricity installed in her home.

loans.use: to buy two heifers, invest in the preparation of her land, and purchase farming supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Imperio Group

texts.es:
Respirar aire puro y ver  día a día los cambios que suele tener la naturaleza es lo que dio origen al nombre del grupo llamado "Imperio" conformado por 7 integrantes los cuales viven en una zona cañera. Precisamente debido este producto, la mayoría de los habitantes de  la localidad trabajan como jornaleros en el campo. El reto para los habitante es la temporada de lluvia  puesto que deben caminar entre los surcos de la caña, pero eso no importa para las personas que han entregado y entregan parte de su vida al campo.

Los integrantes del grupo son: Dulce María- Venta De Oro Laminado, Agustina- Venta De Refrescos, Raquel- Venta De Refrescos, Elizabeth- Venta De Ropa, Andrés- Venta De Refrescos, Belma- Venta De Ropa Y Dulces y Carmina- Venta de comida.

Doña Carmina ha dedicado ya 15 largos años de su vida a vender antojitos y tamales. Hoy en día es muy conocida por toda la comunidad comenta que todo es gracias al sazón que tiene para preparar su comida. Ella comenta que inició vendiendo antojitos de manera ambulante en una canasta, situación que ha cambiado pues ahora vende todos los fines de semana por las tardes en la comodidad de su casa. En cuanto a los tamales de masa o elote, sí continúa vendiendo en las calles de su comunidad. Con el préstamo otorgado comprará gas, maíz, cal, manteca, queso, carne, chiles, platos desechables, crema y bolsas plásticas para continuar con su actividad. Carmina utiliza sus  ganancias para comprar la despensa de su hogar y cubrir los pagos de los servicios (luz, agua, gas) y en la adecuación del corredor para vender sus antojitos.

"Gracias por confiar en nosotros y permitirnos dar un paso más con nuestro negocio" dice doña Carmina.
texts.en:
The group Imperio was named after the fact of breathing pure air and seeing the changes in nature that happen every day. It has 7 members, who live in a sugar-cane area. Most inhabitants work in agriculture and cultivate this product. The challenge for them is the rainy season, as they need to walk among the furrows of cane, but this is not an issue for those who have devoted and devote part of their lives to this activity.

The group members are: Dulce María (sale of laminated gold), Agustina (sale of sodas), Raquel (sale of sodas), Elizabeth (sale of clothes), Andrés (sale of sodas), Belma (sale of clothes and candy) and Carmina (sale of food). Carmina has devoted 15 years to selling tamales (small steamed cakes of dough made from corn) and antojitos (little cravings). Today she is very popular in the community because of how well she prepares the food. She says she started selling "antojitos" in the street with a basket. She now sells at her house on weekend afternoons. The tamales are still sold in the streets. 

She plans to use the loan to buy gas, corn, lime, butter, cheese, meat, chili, disposable plates, cream and plastic bags. Carmina uses what she earns to buy food for her family and to cover expenses (light, water, gas), as well as to make improvements to the location where she sells her "antojitos". 

"Thank you for your trust and for helping us to give another step in our business", says Carmina.

loans.use: to buy gas, corn, lime, butter, cheese, meat, chili, disposable plates, half cream and and plastic bags.

loans.name: G.s. Luz Del Dia Group

texts.es:
El G.S La Luz del Día está conformado por tres integrantes dos varones una mujeres padres responsables de familia con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Ninoska y tiene por  actividad económica la venta de ganado, El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de una res para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Para poder alcanzar sus sueños y metas. El g.s. La Luz del Día agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "La Luz del Día" is made of three members, two men and one woman. They are responsible parents with 10 children under their responsability. They are originally from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern area of the region. They are characterized as being hard-working and responsible, with a desire to improve personally. Unfortunately due to lack of economic resources, they were not able to study. Currently they fight day by day to provide a better future to their children. 

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move forward, the coordinator is Ninoska. She works selling cattle. The business is located in the house where she lives. The objective of the loan is to invest it in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of a cow so that in a future not very far away she will be able to obtain better income. In order to be able to achieve their dreams and goals, the solidarity group La Luz del Día is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and from poor countries like Nicaragua, to have a dignified type of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business in the buying and selling of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is a married woman with four children, all completed school. They live in there own  house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

Kanze operates a clothes selling business at the market to sell to her town dwellers and her neighbors. She cites her major challenge to be seasonal changes. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

She wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increae her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bladin Nilson

texts.es: Don Bladin, tiene 47 años de edad, esta casado, vive con su hijo y su esposa en el municipio de Yoro.  El trabajó por varios años en una empresa privada y hace un año decidió con su esposa establecer una pulpería donde vende azúcar, manteca, café, churros, refrescos, carnes, productos de aseo, condimentos, pan, y otros abarrotes.  El préstamo es por 10,000 Lempiras y va surtir el negocio con carnes, embutidos, refrescos, granos básicos, azúcar y otros que le ayudara a sacar mejor ganancia. Su meta es seguir trabajando con el negocio para darle educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Bladin is 47 years old and lives with his wife and son in the municipality of Yoro. After working for many years at a private company, Bladin and his wife decided to open their own convenience store, where they now sell products such as: sugar, butter, coffee, churros, beverages, meat, canned and prepackaged foods, condiments, bread and other items. 

With the 10,000 Lempiras of support from this loan, Bladin plans to purchase merchandise to stock his business, including: meat, canned and prepackaged products, beverages, staple grains, sugar and other items. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen his business and increase overall profits. Bladin's goal is to keep working at the store so he can support his son and provide him with a good education.

loans.use: to stock his business with meat, canned products, beverages, staple grains, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 55-year-old man from the Kiruhura district. He is honest and hard-working. He has five children, four in school. Denis deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income. He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to help him buy more cattle for fattening. He will use the rest of the loan money to buy more farmland to graze his cattle. He also wants to send his children to good schools if he makes a descent income.
His major challenge is the limited market for milk and cows since there is a lot of competition from other traders. He hopes to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his milk to the market and also construct a permanent home for his family. He cannot fully express the joy he feels for partnering with Kiva lenders. He thanks UGADFODE and the Kiva lenders.
.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 26-year-old single man who takes care of his younger brothers. Emmanuel comes from  Rwetamu Kiruhura district.

He raises cattle as his source of income. He has applied for 3,000,000 UGX to buy more cattle.  He will  use the rest of the money to buy farm land  to graze cattle and pay his  brothers' school fees. 

He has limited capital to run his business and he faces competition from other cattle traders.

His dream is to be the best cattle trader in his area.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Rukia operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of a high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables and fruits and open a new shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and fruits and open a new shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who lives with her husband and two children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is a 55-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is grows coconuts and bananas. She is also a food vender business and cooks suman (rice cake made from glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk and steamed in banana leaves) and biko (sweetened glutinous rice, mixed with brown sugar and mashed). 

She asks for 17,000 PHP to buy rice, sugar and coconut. Isabelita hopes to improve her business profits and support her three dependents at home.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and coconut .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as coal, pepper, cold water, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cold water and coal to sell.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 66-year-old widow from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari sari or retail store business. She sells various goods and items to the people in her place. Several months ago, a typhoon ravaged the country and swept away thousands of households including Juanita's business.

As of this time, Juanita wants to improve her store once again so that it will generate income. With this, she joined CEVI to gain access to loan services offered by the organization to micro entrepreneurs like her. She is requesting a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, candies and snack foods, soap and toiletries. In the future, Juanito hopes that this loan could help her to improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and    beverages, candies and snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough fish, pig feet, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 30 años de edad casada, madre de tres hijos y se dedica al comercio de flores.
Ella es una persona humilde, de buen carácter, su amor por la naturaleza la llevó a dedicarse al cultivo de flores, labor que viene realizando desde hace tres años en la zona ’16 de Julio’ de la ciudad de El Alto distante a once kilómetros de la ciudad de La Paz (capital).
Sara es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, viste de manera tradicional (mata y pollera) su lengua nativa es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo lo realiza  en un espacio habilitado como vivero en el patio de su vivienda, este lugar no cuenta con techo ni carpa por lo que en época de lluvia el agua arruina la producción de flores ocasionando pérdidas económicas.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y darles un mejor futuro a sus tres hijos, para eso ella necesita un invernadero para su vivero, logrando así que el agua de lluvia no arruine su producción y a la vez mejorando su producto’
Es por esos motivos que Sara solicita un préstamo para la compra de una carpa solar y así cumplir sus sueños y los de su familia.
texts.en:
Sara, age 30, is married and has three children.  She sells flowers.  She is a humble person of good character.  Her love of nature took her to growing flowers.  She has been doing this work for three years in the '16 de Julio’ area in the city of El Alto.  It is 11 kilometers from the city of La Paz (the capital).

Sara has a dark complexion and long, braided black hair.  She dresses in a traditional manner (shawl and skirt).  Her native language is Aymara, and she uses Spanish for business.  She works in a space set up as a nursery on the patio of her house.  This place does not have a roof or an awning.  Therefore, during the rainy season the water ruins the flower production, which causes financial losses.

Her dream is to expand her business in order to improve her income and to give her three children a better future.  In order to do so, she needs a greenhouse  for her nursery.  This way she will keep the rainwater for ruining her production, and she will improve her products.

For these reasons, Sara is requesting a loan to buy a solar awning.  This way she will fulfill her dreams and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar awning.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 66-year-old married man who supports a family of four children and his wife adds additional income for the family. Daniel has been operating a tailoring business for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Daniel is now servicing his third loan of KES 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy a sewing machine and additional materials. He plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and hopes to open a textile shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 44-year-old married woman from the town of Baybay, Leyte. She has four children to support. Her eldest is 26 and her youngest is nine. Two children attend school. Her husband grows coconut and corn. 

She helps to support the family by operating a Sari-sari store business, selling charcoal and renting out videos to the people in her community. 

Myrna asks for 30,000 PHP to buy charcoal, canned goods, spices, chips, sugar, and condiments. The loan will help her to recover from the devastation caused by Yolanda typhoon. 

In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, canned goods, spices, chips, sugar and condiments.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 54-year old woman married to Josphat; they have 6 children. She helps to support their family.

Anastacia has operated a food stall for seven years and earns 10,000 KES every month.

She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and requests 30,000 KES to buy beans, maize, and peas to add to her depleted inventory.

Anastacia plans to buy chicks for rearing and animal feed and hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy beans,maize and peas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 28-year-old woman married to Moses. She adds additional income to support their family and and raise two children.  Christine has been operating a soft drink business as a wholesaler distributor for two years.  She earns her 8,000 KES every month.

Christine was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and requests 10,000 KES to buy soft drinks to replenish her inventory.

Christine plans to use the anticipated income to pay her children's school fees and hopes to have a bright future and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to buy  soft drinks.

loans.name: Churonitas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Churonitas está conformado por 9 socias quienes viven por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, les une una meta en común la cual es superarse en sus negocios y sacar adelante a sus familias, los miembros del grupo son personas positivas, alegres y luchadoras. Cuenca es una ciudad que tiene una belleza tanto natural como arquitectónica, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.	
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Blanca tiene 38 años de edad, está divorciada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 8 años que está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña Blanca pasa en casa al cuidado de su hijo, pero para solventar los gastos de la casa cuenta con su propio negocio, tiene una tienda de abarrotes en donde labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de víveres para ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es viajar a diferentes lugares del mundo.
texts.en:
The group Las Churonitas is made up of nine upbeat, determined women, all of whom live in and around the city of Cuenca. They are united by the common goal of strengthening their respective business endeavors and providing for their families. Cuenca is a city with great natural and architectural beauty, and since December of 1999, Cuenca has been a United Nations World Heritage Site. The people of the region still live out and maintain the cultures and traditions of their ancestors and heritage.

One of the group members is Blanca, who is 38 years old and is a single mother to her 8-year-old son, who is studying at a local school. Blanca and her son are currently renting the house where they live. In order to support her son and cover household expenses, Blanca runs a small convenience store where she works seven days a week. With the support from this loan, Blanca plans to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store and offer a wider variety of products to her customers. Blanca's dream is to one day travel the world and see new places.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her convenience store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 28-year-old father of 1 who lives in the Kerugoya area which is located in the central province of Kenya. 

He has farmed for 5 years and earns an honest and decent income. John has both crops and a dairy farm and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for John.  However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces.

John seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming.  His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network,  climate and market demand.

John and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life.

John is disciplined regarding finances and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and a obtain a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to venture into other areas of farming.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with 6 children, all attend school. She owns a house without running  water and electricity. 

Eunice sells coconuts at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She wants to purchase bulk quantities of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of coconuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, butter, yeast, and milk.

loans.name: Marstellar

texts.en:
Marstellar  is single  woman with 9 children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 3 years, she has owned a food stall business. She faces a major challenge of changing customer base which leads to loss of perishable items.

She wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman, with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a food café business, selling from home to passersby and neighbors. She dreams of establishing a restaurant shop in the future.

With the loan of KES 20,000 she is requesting, Eunice wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat oil, potatoes, wheat flour, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat oil, potatoes, wheat flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 25-year-old man married with 1 child who attends school. He is a resident of the Nyabuhikye ibanda district.

Peter has a motorcycle repair business. He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to  buy spare parts in order to increase his business and sales.  He will  use the rest of the money to pay his child's school fees.

His major challenge is a limited market for his spare parts. His dream is to become a one stop shopping center for all spare parts seller in Ibanda district. 

Peter is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Fe y Esperanza está conformada por ocho integrantes madres soltera de una comunidad llamada La rreynaga,  se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente estas mujeres no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad luchan para sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María Mercedes	Y  Tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda ubicada en suc casa de habitación. El negocio consiste en vender productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón, azúcar.  El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica  a  su negocio unas doce horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. La asociación comunal  Fe y Esperanza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza [Faith and Hope] Communal Bank is made up of eight members who are single mothers from the Larreynaga community. These women are hardworking, trustworthy, and ambitious to improve their lives. Unfortunately they could pursue an education due to lack of financial resources. They are currently striving to provide greater opportunities to their children. 

María Mercedes is the group's coordinator. She puts forth a lot of effort and strives to be successful. She runs a small convenience store located in her home. She sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, and sugar. María Mercedes works 12 hours a day at her store. She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in working capital, increase her inventory, and earn higher income in the near future. The members of Fe y Esperanza group are grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people of limited means in poor countries such as Nicaragua. This support helps borrowers earn a decent, honest living.

loans.use: invest in working capital and increase her store's inventory to sell groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, and soap.

loans.name: Cleopas

texts.en:
Cleopas is a 46-year-old  married man with six children.  Cleopas has been a farmer for  ten years and earns an income of 10,000 KES every month.

Cleopas was introduced to VisionFund Kenya and requests 30,000 KES to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm. Cleopas plans to use the anticipated income to  pay his children's school fees and hopes to buy additional land to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a new client to the organization, who has applied for a loan of UGX.800,000. He is 23 years old. He hails from western division, Rukungiri municipality. He is single and still stays with his mother and he takes care of his mother since his father died when he was still young and his mother was unable to educate him to higher levels. 

Emmanuel does agriculture as his source of income. He has applied for this loan to buy fertilizer to increase his production and earn more income to be able to meet his financial needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Adilu

texts.en:
Adilu is a 50-year-old  married man with 6 children; 3 attend school.  He is from Kibare, which is in the Kanungu district.

 Adilu has been a  carpenter for 15 years and relies on his business to meet his financial needs. He decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance to expand his business and pay for school fees. 

Adilu applied for 2,500,000 UGX to buy  timber to broaden his market and increase the profitability of his business. 

Adilu thanks Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled him to educate his children and sustain his business.

loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman with seven children. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mishi operates a food making business and sells to passersby and neighbors. The will use the 20,000 KES she  to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice,  oil and other items..

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 65 years old. She lives alone in the small village of Sighnaghi district, Kakheti region, East Georgia. Lali has a retirement pension. She has no source of income and decided to start her own business. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL. She will purchase clothes and bed-clothes at wholesale prices and sell them. 

She will be able to earn a stable income and improve her living conditions with the increased income.

loans.use: to start a clothes and bed-clothes business in order to have stable income.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is an experienced client at the organization.  She is a single mother with 2 children; all attend school. 

She has operated a small eating place and bar for 7 years.  Clare has limited capital and asks for financial assistance to compete in the market. Clare hopes that this loan of 3,000,000 will help her to  buy soft drinks to sell to her customers so that she will increase her sales and earns more profit. 

Clare praises Ugafode for financial assistance which has enabled her to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy soda and juice.

loans.name: Annaisathya Self-Help Group - Veerakkan

texts.en:
Ananthavalli is the featured borrower of the Annaisathya Self-Help Group (SHG). She lives in a small hamlet, Veerakkan, in Tanjore district. She is married and has two children. They live in a house made with a thatched roof. Her husband is a farmer by profession.

Ananthavalli has taken out loans from the local NGO People's Action for Transformation (PAT) previously to improve their livelihood and repaid on time. This NGO also conducts training for the members of the group to help them become independent.

Ananthavalli and the other 16 diligent women are each seeking a loan to buy a smokeless stove for their kitchens. This will help them to have good fresh air in their houses in place of the smoke that is emitted from the mud stoves they are using. With these stoves, they will lead a healthier life.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Los Trapiches Group

texts.es:
Los miembros del grupo “Los Trapiches” se conocen desde hace más de 20 años. La convivencia y experiencia los  ha llevado a consolidar un grupo para pedir prestamos en VisionFund México los cuales les han sido otorgados y con ellos han incrementado poco a poco con sus negocios; comentan que lo mejor de todo es que se quieren como familia.

El grupo esta integrado por 7 personas de las cuales cada una de ellas se dedica a una actividad económica productiva la cual les da ingresos y con ellos solventan parte de los gastos de su hogar:
Hortencia- Venta De Ropa, Petra- Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo, Rocío- Venta De Calzado, Gabina - Venta De Ropa, Jorge- Venta De Refrescos, Claudia- Venta De Pan y Alberto- albañilería.

Alberto es una persona alegre quien a pesar de estar enfermo y caminar con ayuda de un bastón se ha dedicado desde hace ya cerca de tres años al oficio de albañilería. Comenta que aprendió de sus tíos a quienes ayudaba desde joven. “He iniciado con el oficio de albañil para apoyar a mis padres con los gastos de la casa” de igual manera comenta que cuando lo contratan para construir alguna casa o cuarto se siente satisfecho con el oficio que desempeña al poder contribuir con el bienestar de una familia y más si si se trata de su barrio donde le ayudaron demasiado cuando él sufrió un accidente. El préstamo otorgado lo utilizará para la compra de niveles, hilo, cincel, martillo, marro, clavos, para continuar con su actividad. Los integrantes del grupo comentan que la mayoría del barrio conoce a Alberto como “El constructor”.

"Gracias a Dios y a VisionFund México por brindarnos nuevas oportunidades" comenta "El Constructor".

***En la foto: Alberto está de pie detrás de su hermana Petra, vestida de azul y sentada.
texts.en:
The members of the "Los Trapiches" communal bank have known each other for more than 20 years.  Their experience together has led them to consolidate as a group to borrow from Mexico's Vision Fund.  With these loans, they have gradually expanded their businesses. They comment that the best thing is that they love each other like family.

This group has 7 members, each with their own business activity that generates income and helps them cover their household expenditures.  The members include: Hortencia, who sells clothing, Petra, who sells shoes through a catalog, Rocio, who sells shoes, Gabina, who sells clothing, Jorge, who sells drinks, Claudia, who sells bread, and Alberto, who is a bricklayer. 

Alberto is a happy person who, in spite of his illness and walking with a cane, has been working for 3 years as a bricklayer.  He comments that he learned from his uncles, who used to help him when he was young.  "I started working as a bricklayer to support my parents with the household expenses," he comments.  He also says that when he is hired to build a house or room he feels satisfied with the work that he performs and his ability to contribute to his family's welfare, and this is particularly the case when he works in his neighborhood where the people helped him so much when he suffered an accident. This loan will help Alberto to buy masonry tools including: levels, masonry string, a chisel, a hammer, a sledge hammer, and nails so that he can continue with his work.  

The members of this group comment that most of the people in the neighborhood know Alberto as "The Builder."  Alberto says, "Thanks to God and to VisionFund Mexico for providing us with new opportunities."  

Note:  in the photo, Alberto is standing behind his sister Petra, who is dressed in blue and is seated.

loans.use: to buy masonry equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy red oil, and Algol oil.

loans.name: Ramona Felipa

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Aquí vive la señora Ramona, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de  seis  hijos, cinco mayores de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudia en colegio, cuatro de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Ramona es una muy buena madre que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para así sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y de productos de plástico para lo cual tiene un local en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 con la ayuda de sus hijos. Ella también recorre puerta a puerta pero solo vendiendo la ropa, vende al contado y también deja a créditos pero a los clientes más conocidos. Tiene más de 22 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saco a sus hijos adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y productos de plásticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han dado. Sus sueños son que su hijo menor sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group Mujeres Progresistas meets every 15 days in the canton of Jipijapa in a region known as the "Sultana of Coffee" for its expansive coffee plantations producing a unique flavor, their cuisine, and the warmth of its people.

Here lives Ramona, 56, the single mother of six children of whom five are adults and the youngest is a 16-year-old studying in high school. Four children still live at home.
Ramona is a goof mother who saw the need to work in order to raise her children. She is a merchant, selling clothing and all kinds of plastic goods in a room in her home. She works there everyday from 8 am to 6 pm with the help of her children. She also goes door-to-door selling clothes for cash and allows people she knows well to pay on credit. She has been doing this work for more than 22 years which has helped her raise her children.

This loan will be used to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and plastic products. She has been in this credit group from the beginning and likes the help they have always given. Her dreams are for her youngest son to be a professional.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and plastic products to sell

loans.name: Jacquline Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Progresistas se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 
Aquí vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo de 20 años que estudia en universidad y vive con ella. 
Doña Jacqueline es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella trabaja en una ferretería de la ciudad desde hace muchos años, pero además de esto ella también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, su hijo le ayuda con sus ventas en la actualidad, mientras ella por las noches recorre la ciudad vendiendo su hijo se desplaza a los campos lugar donde tienen muchos clientes, dejan su mercadería a crédito y cobran por semana o quincena. Lleva más de 15 años con este negocio el cual le da lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sabanas y edredones. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha salido adelante. Sus sueños es que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Progressive Women's Credit Group meets every two weeks in Jipijapa Canton. Jipijapa is also the name of the variety of coffee, with its unmatched flavor, that many local farmers grow. The area is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of the people. Jipijapa is also the home of  Señora Jacqueline, 45 years old and the single mother of a 20-year-old university student who lives with her. 

Señora Jacqueline has always enjoyed working in order to support her son. She has for many years had a job in a local hardware store, but also has business selling all types of clothing and bedding. Señora Jacqueline spends evenings visiting customers to make sales on credit. Her son helps with the business, making deliveries to customers in the surrounding area, and then returning to collect payment one or two weeks later. Señora Jacqueline has run this business for over 15 years, which she started to earn additional income and improve her situation. 

Señora Jacqueline is applying for a loan to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, sheets, and comforters. She's been a member of the Progressive Women's Credit Group for over three years and is pleased with the benefits membership has provided her. Previous loans have allowed her to strengthen her business. She hopes her son will finish his studies and then begin a professional career.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, sheets, and comforters.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es: Adriano tiene 22 años de edad y habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad; allí tiene un pequeño almacén de ropa y  calzado para damas, caballeros e infantil, que necesita surtir con ropa diversa  para impactar a su clientela. Su desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograrlo y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos con diseños modernos. Él está muy entusiasmado siempre, porque conoce su actividad desde muy joven, pues su familia es de  naturaleza comerciante y quiere continuar los pasos de su madre y su abuela. Sus ventas las realiza de lunes a sábados desde as 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche sin cesar,comprando a mayoristas para que sus clientes obtengan los mejores precios y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva tenga éxito.
texts.en: Adriano is 22 years old and lives in a town near the city. There he has a small clothing and footwear store for men, women and children. He needs to stock different clothes to impact his customers. His challenge is to have sufficient working capital to achieve this, which is precisely the reason to use a credikiva (Kiva loan). His first financing is through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which he will use to buy dresses with modern designs. He is always enthusiastic, because he knows his business very young, but his family members are merchants as well and he wishes to follow in the footsteps of his mother and grandmother. His sales are carried out from Monday to Saturday as 8 am to 8 pm without a break. He buys wholesale for his customers to get the best prices and this is precisely what will make his credikiva succeed.

loans.use: to buy dresses with modern designs.

loans.name: Mar Caribe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras que se unieron hace 3 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento y mejorar sus ingresos familiares y comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de venta de frijoles, mariscos y pulpería.  

María Elena: Es una joven amable, trabajadora, coordinadora del grupo solidario, tiene 23 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos. Su esposo es soldador. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y mejor la calidad de vida de su familia estableció su pequeño negocio hace 4 años de venta de ropa usada. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: Una paca de ropa usada para niños y venderla a precios accesibles en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y establecer una pulpería
texts.en:
Three tenacious women came together three months ago to form The Mar Caribe [Caribbean Sea] Solidarity Group. One of the members sells beans, another sells shellfish, and the third member plans to open a small grocery store. The members want to gain access to financing, purchase merchandise for their businesses, and earn higher income for their families. 

María Elena is a kindhearted young woman, hardworking, and serves as the group's coordinator. She is 23 years old, married to a young man who works as a welder, and is the mother of two children. María Elena started a used clothing business four years ago so she could earn her own income and improve her family's quality of life. María Elena is applying for her first loan to purchase a bundle of used children's clothing in Managua. She'll then these items at reasonable prices in the town of Puerto Cabezas. María Elena hopes to improve the infrastructure of her business and fulfill her ambition to open her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase a used children's clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando  trabaja con un ingeniero realizando instalaciones eléctricas, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, vive con sus padres y hermanos. Sus metas futuras son la de recibirse de Ingeniero en electricidad y trabajar de forma independiente, seguir estudiando para tener buenos ingresos y ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir los gastos de manutención, como ser fotocopias, materiales varios, etc.
texts.en:
Armando works with an engineer doing electrical installations.  He is from San Lorenzo and lives with his parents and siblings.  Armando's goals for the future are to graduate as an electrical engineer, to work independently and to continue studying so he can earn a good income and help his family. 
Armando is asking for this loan in order to invest in covering his education expenses, like making photocopies, for various materials etc.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses such as making photocopies and for study materials.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
La  asociación comunal  Dios es Amor está conformada por diez integrantes, madres y padres responsables de familia, originarias de  Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado,  en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad luchan por tener un medio de trabajo digno. Y brindarles mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es María y tiene por actividad económica la  venta de cosa de horno de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. La rutina de trabajo de  María es de unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Ella recorre los diferentes municipios de la localidad. Y dos veces  a la semana sale a  vender a las ciudades de Leon, toma el bus muy de mañana con una pana de unos  30 kg ofreciendo su mercadería a clientes fijos y eventuales. La asociación comunal Dios es Amor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Dios es Amor" communal bank is made up of 10 members who are mothers and fathers responsible for their family. They are originally from Malpaisillo, located in the western part of the country. They are hard-working, responsible people wishing to succeed. 

Due to lack of financial resources, they were unfortunately unable to study for a career, and were required to start working at an early age. Today they strive for decent work, and to offer their children better living conditions.

Maria is the coordinator, thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead. Her business is selling "cosa de horno" baked goods, both as street vendor and from her home. 

Maria's work routine is offering her goods for sale some 12 hours per day. She covers the different towns locally, and twice a week she goes out to the cities of Leon, taking the early morning bus, carrying 30 kgs of goods to sell to her steady and potential clients.

The "Dios es Amor" communal bank is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva offer to people of low economic resources and from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, to make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing "cosa de horno" baked goods.

loans.name: Salla's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en 2011,ce groupe repose sur une garantie solidaire,les membres habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

Bigué qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 28 ans,est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Son activité principale est le commerce de sucre,de légumes,d'huile,de vermicelles,de riz.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 01 sac de sucre à 30000f le sucre,des condiments jumbo,poivre pour 13000f,02 sacs d'oignons pour 16000f,un bidon de 20l d'huile à 13000f,01 paquet de vermicelle pour 3000f,01 sac de riz à 12500f plus les frais de transport valeur 10000f.

Son objectif est de financer les études de ses enfants,assister son mari en achetant un sac de riz pour la restauration de sa famille.
texts.en:
Created in 2011, this group is held together by a guarantee of solidarity. Its members live in the same village and work as vendors and farmers.

Bigué, the one on the right raising her hand in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of six children, four of them boys. She mainly works as a vendor selling sugar, vegetables, oil, pasta, rice etc.

With her loan, she plans to buy one bag of sugar at 30,000 West African francs, some condiments of the Jumbo brand, pepper for 13,000 francs, two bags of onions at 16,000 francs, one jug of vegetable oil at 13,000 francs, one pack of pasta at 3,000 francs, one bag of rice  at 12,500 francs, and also cover the delivery costs of 10,000 francs. Bigué’s goal is to pay for her children’s education and  help her husband by buying a bag of rice to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy one bag of sugar, two bags of onions, one jug of oil, one pack of pasta, and one bag of rice.

loans.name: Hector Edgardo

texts.es: Héctor de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Héctor solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Héctor is 36-years old and lives in his own home with his family.  He has made his living in agriculture for a number of years, in particular growing corn and beans.  Héctor sells his products in the neighborhoods surrounding his zone.  With what he earns from his sales, he helps with some of the expenses that come up in his home.  Héctor is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, compost etc. and thereby be able to give his family a better quality of life, one without limitations.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, compost etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough goods such as diapers, cream, pampers etc. to sell.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: Carolina del Carmen: Es originaria de Chinandega, tiene 27 años, casada con 2 hijos, la mayor de 6 años estudia su primer grado de primaria y la menor de 2 años. Su esposo trabaja en una institución del gobierno central. Desde hace 7 años se traslado a Rosita por motivos familiares y estableció su pulpería en un anexo de su vivienda de concreto, con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos. Inicio con C$ 5000 (Cinco Mil Córdobas Netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar en Managua: Ropa interior, desodorantes, pantalones, camisas, sandalias cremas, perfumes entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Carolina del Carmen is from Chinandega. She is 27 years old, she is married, and she has 2 children. The oldest one, who is 6 years old, attends 1st grade in elementary school. The youngest is 2 years old. 

Her husband works in an Institution, which is part of the Central Government. She moved to Rosita 7 years ago for family reasons. She opened a convenience store in a room next to her house, which is made out of concrete. She wanted to have her own income. She started with C$ 5,000 (5,000 Cordobas).

She is requesting this financing to have a bigger variety of products, and to be able to buy in Managua, the following articles: underwear, deodorants, pants, shirts, sandals, lotions, perfume, among other products. Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy underwear, deodorants, pants, shirts, sandals, lotions, perfume, among other products.

loans.name: Surat

texts.en:
Surat is 21 years old. He is single and lives in his family home with his parents. He is asking for a loan of 1,200 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops. 

Vegetable gardening is big business for many rural farmers in the region. Surat grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. His father is helping him in this business. Last season he grew cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers and watermelons. 

His monthly income is about 180 azn from this business. Surat needs your financial support. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest  organization for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es una persona que esta esforzándose por poder salir adelante, ya pudo terminar su colegio, y hoy día ya esta en la universidad, luchando por mejorar, ya está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, con lo que quiere poder salir adelante y ser una persona útil a la sociedad.
Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en cubrir sus tramites para la culminación de su colegio, lo que le fue de mucha ayuda. Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luis is someone who is working hard to get ahead. He was able to finish high school, and is now in university, striving to improve. He is studying business administration, which he hopes will help him be successful and become a useful member of society. 

Luis used his previous loan, which was very helpful, to pay for the final fees needed to finish high school. Today is he requesting a new loan to use to pay for his university costs and thus be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Mtoro

texts.en:
Mtoro is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a cereal shop business, selling from home to her potential customers, her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Mtoro dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 15,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria Teresa is a Sari-sari (variety) store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She is 52 years old and married with five children, ages 10 to 31. Two of her children are still attending school. While her husband works in Manila as a driver, it is not easy for her to look after her children alone. In spite of that she continues doing business through her small store. 

A few months back, it was badly hit by the typhoon Yolanda. She is asking for a loan to buy chips, candies, cooking oil, condiments, toiletries, coffee and milk, and to repair her store. 

She is optimistic with what the future can bring with the help of the loan. In the future, she hopes to have better business profits and to make her store bigger.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, cooking oil, condiments, toiletries, coffee and milk, and to repair her store.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio de 55 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y de frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Julio esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con sus siembras y poderle  dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Julio, 55, lives with his family in his own home. He earns a living by growing corn and beans. He sells his products in different markets close to his home. The money he makes allows him to cover some of his household expenses. 

Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, manure, pest control, etc, in order to continue growing his crops and provide his family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, manures, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es una persona muy emprendedora y luchadora, que está estudiando para poder capacitarse y ser alguien en la vida.
Quiere ser enfermera y de esa forma ayudar a las demás personas en la sociedad. Su meta es trabajar en su profesión como licenciada en enfermería y seguir estudiando para ocupar los mejores cargos en instituciones públicas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene y podrá llegar a su meta.
texts.en:
Mirna is from the city of Carapeguá. She is an enterprising and determined person who is studying in order to acquire skills and make something of herself. She wants to be a nurse and help others. Her goal is to work in this field with a nursing degree, and to continue studying so that she will qualify for the best jobs in the public institutions. 

Mirna is requesting this loan to pay for her educational costs, as this will allow her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay for educational costs.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Agnes, a 56-year-old who is very hardworking, energetic and a mother of 4 lovely children. Agnes resides in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. Agnes has been doing mixed farming for the past 40 years and through those years she has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. 

Through the income from farming she has been able to take care of her family and also provide the basic needs for her grandchildren. Agnes is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal.

The Kerugoya area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate and a good transport network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business.

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Agnes feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Agnes is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions and also secure the future of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty  is married and has been blessed with 9 children, three of whom attend school. Her husband is a farmer and he contributes in the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Betty has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she operates a cereals business. She faces a major challenge with the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of  maize, beans, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Sergio Jose

texts.es: Sergio José: Es un señor amable, originario de Managua, tiene 38 años de edad, casado con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Se traslado a Puerto Cabezas desde hace 2 años, con el propósito de establecer su negocio de artículos plásticos, ubicado en un punto estratégico en un local que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$ 1,500 (Un mil Quinientos Córdobas Netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua: Escobas, panas, baldes, vasos, tinas, paraguas, rastrillos entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Sergio Jose: A kind man, originally from Managua, 38 years old, married with 2 school aged children. He moved to Puerto Cabezas 2 years ago with the purpose of establishing a plastic goods business located at a strategic point in a place he rents paying C$ 1,500 monthly (one thousand five hundred Córdobas Netos). He is requesting his first loan to buy merchandise in Managua: Brooms, bowls, buckets, glasses, wash basins, umbrellas and rakes, among other products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in Managua: Brooms, bowls, buckets, glasses, wash basins, umbrellas and rakes, among other products.

loans.name: Kamila

texts.es:
Kamila tiene 18 años de edad, vive con sus tíos pues sus padres son separados.
Es la primera en la familia que se interesa por estudiar una carrera universitaria, tiene el apoyo de sus tíos trabaja en un estudio jurídico como asistente. Está estudiando la carrera de laboratorio clínico, y con ello podrá generar los ingresos que necesita para poder darse una mejor calidad de vida.
Quiere pagar sus cuotas, es por eso que pide este préstamo.
texts.en:
Kamila is 18 years old, and lives with her aunt and uncle, as her parents are separated. She is the first in her family who wants to go to university. She has the support of her aunt and uncle. She currently works as an assistant in a law firm. 

Kamila is studying to work in a clinical laboratory, which will allow her to earn the income she needs to have a better quality of life. She would like to pay her tuition fees, and this is why she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to pay university costs.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is married and has been blessed with seven children, five of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Constance operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Constance dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Annalou

texts.en:
Annalou is a married woman and a mother of two children, ages 7 and 2. Annalou lives in the town of Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. She is engaged in manicure and pedicure services. She also sells dressed chickens to her customers.

Her business was drastically affected when Typhoon Haiyan hit the country last year. As a result, her income slowed down. Now Annalou is requesting a loan of 10,000K to buy additional materials for her manicure service, like nail polish, nail cutters, polish remover and others, as well as fresh chickens to sell. With this, Annalou will be able to improve her business and augment her income. In the future, Annalou hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her manicure service, like nail polish, nail cutters, polish remover and others, as well as fresh chicken to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 33 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Desde 3 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos, periodo que ha trabajado con financiamiento en la modalidad de grupos solidarios. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de créditos individuales, con el propósito de comprar productos del mar y distribuirlos a precios accesibles a empresas exportadoras del municipio. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto y su propia panga.
texts.en: Norma: Originally from Puerto Cabezas, 33 years old, married with 2 school aged children. For the past 3 years she has made a living selling seafood. A time period that she has worked with funding in the form of solidarity groups. She is requesting financing for the first time in the form of individual loans with the intention of buying seafood products and distributing them at affordable prices to export companies from the city. Her dream is to have a concrete home and her own dinghy.

loans.use: to buy seafood products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell, such as cartons of fish, chicken, pigs feet, etc.

loans.name: Athiparasakthi Shg-Puthupalayam Group

texts.en:
Rasathi is the leader of Athiparasakthi Self-Help Group (SHG) managed by the local NGO People’s Action for Transformation (PAT). Rasathi is married and is living in Puthupalayam, a small village in Tanjore district. She is 48 years old and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.

Rasathi recently learned about Greenway Smart Stove, a sustainable stove that reduces smoke emissions up to 70%, resulting in better long-term health due to decreased inhalation of the poisonous gas. Rasathi and the other four members are requesting a loan to buy this stove to give a healthier life to their families. They are extremely excited about the possibility of saving on fuel and having less smoke emissions in their houses.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, esta siguiendo la carrera de ingeniero agronomo, ya que de esa forma quiere ser alguien en la vida, que pueda ser util a la sociedad.
El es vendedor y cobrador, y con este trabajo está luchando por poder cubrir sus gastos. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, de manera a seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en: Alexis is from the city of Caaguazú. He is studying to be an agricultural engineer, as this way he can make something of himself in life and be a useful member of society. He currently works as a salesperson, and is struggling to cover his expenses with this work. He is a hard-working and determined person. He is requesting this loan in order to cover his educational costs, and thus continue working towards his goals.

loans.use: to pay for educational costs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es madre de familia y a la vez estudiante de la carrera de licenciatura en enfermería. Comenta que su mayor aspiración es mejorar su situación económica y así darles un buen futuro a sus hijos, ya que ellos son su razón de ser.
Esta esforzándose mucho por poder ser alguien útil en la sociedad y a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Josefina is a mother and she is also a student of nursing. She says that her biggest goal is to improve her financial situation and thus giver her children a good future, be cause they are her reason for being.  

She is working very hard to be able to be a person who is useful to society and her family. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her college tuition. This way, she can keep going to school as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a married man with two children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 20 years, he has operated a food café business, selling from home to passersby and neighbors. He dreams of establishing a restaurant shop in the future.

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cooking fat oil, potatoes, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es estudiante de Arquitectura, vive con sus padres, está estudiando la carrera de arquitectura y comenta que su  meta es culminar su carrera y de esa forma ser una Arquitecta reconocida por su carrera, abriendo su propia oficina Constructora y Consultora para todo tipo de obras.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus cuotas, y seguir con sus estudios, luchando por su objetivo.
texts.en:
Claudia is an architecture student. She lives with her parents and is studying architecture. She says that her goal is to finish her major and become a well known architect, opening her own Construction and Consulting firm for all types of works.  

She is asking for this loan to cover her tuition and to stay in school, fighting for her goal.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman and a mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte. Her husband is farmer. Imelda has been engaged in a sewing business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. Imelda's business was severely affected when a typhoon hit her place several months ago causing her income to decline.

Imelda is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing like cloth, thread, needles and a new sewing machine. Through this loan, Imelda will be able to accept orders from her customers, thus augmenting her income. Imelda hopes of making her business a success so that she will be able to support her husband in providing the needs of the family, especially for their daily consumption.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing, like cloth, thread, needles and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 52-year old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with  three children, ages 12-22. One of her children is still studying in high school. Thelma's husband works as a driver to support their family. Thelma also helps by operating a sari-sari store business, and cooking meal food for the people in her neighborhood. 

She is asking for a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy noodles, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, canned goods, fish, vegetables and condiments.

She hopes to have a better profit and eventually be able to expand her businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, canned goods, fish, vegetables and condiments

loans.name: Ndara

texts.en:
Ndara is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Mazhilampoo Shg-Veerakkan Group

texts.en:
PAT (People Action for Transformation) manages the self-help group Mazhilampoo. PAT helps the members improve their livelihood.

Maheswari is the leader of the group. She lives in Veerakkan village, Tanjore district. Maheswari is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her child and her husband. He is a farmer. Maheswari has previously taken out loans from PAT to improve her livelihood and has always repaid loans on time.

Maheswari and the other 15 members are requesting a loan to buy smokeless stoves, which cost 1,400 Indian rupees (INR). They are better than the traditional mud stoves. The traditional stove emits a lot of smoke and soot. Smokeless stoves are affordable and comfortable for cooking and produce less carbon dioxide compared to the traditional stoves.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as used clothes, blouses, trousers, etc to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Moses 23-years-of age, very young, hardworking and energetic. He hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming. Moses is still single and has been doing farming for the past three years.

Moses was raised in a humble family, and he never got the opportunity to go to college because of lack of tuition fees. As a result of this, he never got any formal employment and didn’t surrender to that. He started farming, and through farming he has been able to take care of his family and also to take care of his parents.

Moses source of income are vegetables, milk, and egg selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that he faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kerugoya area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Moses is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the motorbike he will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh.

Moses is very determined to succeed and because he is very disciplined with finances, he plans that through accumulated profits he will be able to provide a secure future for himself and also for his parents.

Moses' dream is to go back to school and he hopes that through your loan, you will help him realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix es de la ciudad de Lambaré, es estudiante y también está trabajando con personas importantes de la profesión que escogió, que es la de ingeniería comercial.
Sus padres son quienes lo inspiran a poder seguir con sus metas y objetivos. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma cubrir sus gastos de estudios, y poder luchar por sus objetivos.
Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder seguir sus metas.
texts.en: Felix is from the city of Lambaré.  He is a student and also works with important people in his chosen field of commercial engineering.  His parents are who inspire him to continue with his goals and objectives.  He is seeking this loan to be able to pay his tuition and cover his school expenses so that he can continue fighting for his goals.  He is thankful for this opportunity that he is receiving to continue with his goals.

loans.use: pay college tuition.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is married with eight children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kenga operates a cow selling business, selling at the market to his neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. His dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, Kenga wants to purchase three cows for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase three cows for resale

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan, aged 25, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He sells second-hand clothes in a market stall and also does farming. 

Allan is a  hard-working man who desires to have a boutique in the future despite having inadequate capital. He will use the money from the loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, aged 65, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of whom attend school. As a retailer, he finds that his business is hindered by inadequate capital. 

John is taking out a loan to buy more sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell. As a shrewd businessman, John desires to grow into becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Juana tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de nivel académico, ella es viuda desde hace 12 años, en su matrimonio procreó 8 hijos  los cuales solo dos están con ella los demás están en hogares aparte, solo dos hijos y dos nietos dependen de ella.

Juana se dedica a atender en un molino que inició como un negocio familiar hace 18 años, lo compraron con mucho sacrificio y desde entonces atienden a las personas de la comunidad que llegan a moler, atiende de 9: 00 a 11:00 am y de 3:00 a 4:00 pm. Además Juana se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeña, lo aprendió de su padre, sus hijos se involucran en el trabajo con el objetivo de salir adelante.

Juana necesita el crédito para comprar un buey ya que ellos tienen una yunta pero uno de los bueyes se cayó y se dañó un cabo y ya no le será útil para el trabajo que ella hace con los hijos en la milpa.

Sus sueños son que Dios siempre le de vida para poder seguir dándoles el alimento a los hijos ya que es madre soltera pero eso no ha impedido que ella siga adelante, espera seguir trabajando en el molino ya que es su mayor fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old, she studied up to the second grade, she was widowed 12 years ago, the marriage produced 8 children of which only two live with her and the others have their separate homes, only two children and two grandchildren are dependent on her.

Juana works taking care of a mill, it started as a family business 18 years ago, they bought it through much sacrifice and since then they have served the people from the community who come to mill, they serve from 9:00 to 11:00 am and from 3:00 to 4:00 pm. Also Juana has worked in farming since she was young, she learnt it from her parents, her children are involved in the work with the aim of getting ahead in life.

Juana needs the loan to purchase an oxen, as they have a team [of oxen] but one of the oxen fell and injured its stump and so it won't be any use for the work that she does with her children in the cornfield.

Her dreams are that God will always give her life to be able to continue providing food to her children, as she is a single mother now but this has not stopped her from moving forward, she hopes to continue working in the mill as it is her main source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a new oxen, as one of her oxen fell and was injured.

loans.name: Sri Ramajayam Shg-Natchiyar Kovil Group

texts.en:
Sri Ramajayam Self-Help Group is managed by the NGO, People’s Action for Transformation (PAT), in Tamil Nadu. This group consists of seven members from Natchiyar Kovil village, Ariyalur district.

Vijayalakshmi is the leader of group. She lives with her family in her own house; she is the mother of a child. Her husband is a daily-wage worker.

Vijayalakshmi, along with the other group members, needs a loan to purchase a smokeless stove. It is durable, handy, easy to use, and sustainable. It emits less smoke, which reduces the risk of respiratory diseases. The traditional mud stove emits more carbon dioxide, due to which children are affected the most, leading to asthma, bronchitis, etc.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
