texts.en: Abdu is a Babban Gona farmer from Makera. Abdu expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Abdu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abdu is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 50 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Abdu will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Abdu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Sabo Umar

texts.en: Sabo Umar is a Babban Gona farmer from Makera. Sabo Umar expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Sabo Umar to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Sabo Umar can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Sabo Umar, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Sabo Umar will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home”. With this loan, Sabo Umar will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Silone

texts.en:
Silone is a 33-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small plantation and canteen business, selling to the children in school, members of her community and also to the public. This is the third year she has been with the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. 

Silone will use this money to purchase chemicals and a mist blower for further improvement of her plantation business. Silone has managed to improve her family's living standards from the income of her business and hopes to continue to maintain the running of her business, for it provides them with a good income.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals and a mist blower.

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feeds. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 41 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children of school age.
 
Mary Jean has been engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sales groceries and other consumable products for two years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods for retail.

Mary Jean has been a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Mary Jean hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries and other consumable goods.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 43 years old and lives in Camanga, Tukuran. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Alma has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She earns about 15,000 pesos each month doing this type of work.

Alma has a requested a loan to buy stock for her fruits and vegetables business. Alma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Alma would like to become fruits and vegetable supplier in their place.

loans.use: To buy stock for her fruits and vegetables business

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz Mery tiene un puesto en su casa donde distribuye productos de uso personal como perfumes, cremas de manos, productos capilares entre otros.
Anteriormente se desempeñaba como operaria pero pro el nacimiento de su segundo hijo decidió estar en casa y montar un negocio que le permitiera ayudar a su esposo con los gatos del hogar.

Hasta el día de hoy se siente bendecida pues está al pendiente de sus 3 hijos y atiende constantemente el negocio.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de productos por revista los cuales compra en combo y os vende por unidad obteniendo buena rentabilidad por sus ventas.  

Para ella este crédito es muy transcendental pues podrá seguir teniendo una libertar económica y no depende de lo que su esposo le quiera o pueda dar, siempre tendrá su propio fondo para invertir ella salud, bienestar y educación de sus hijos. 

Sueña en un periodo de 3 años duplicar su número de clientes y para ello necesita productos disponibles para vender.
texts.en:
Luz Mery sells products such as perfumes, hand creams and hair care products at home. She used to work as a machine operator, but she had to quit in order to stay home and take care of her second child. She started a business to be able to help her husband with the home expenses. So far, she feels that being able to take care of her three children and her business at the same time is a blessing.

She is requesting a loan to buy products on a catalogue. She buys sets of products and  sells them individually, which results in good profits.

This loan is very important for her, as she will be able to maintain her financial freedom and will not need to depend on what her husband wants or can give her. She will always have her own source of money to invest in her children’s health, well-being and education.

Her dream is to double the amount of customers she has in three years. For this, she needs to have enough products in stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy products on a catalogue, such as perfumes, hand creams and hair care products.

loans.name: Abdulrahaman

texts.en: Abdulrahaman remembers the extreme poverty that his family faced  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Abdulrahaman, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abdulrahaman  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Abdulrahaman   With this loan, Abdulrahaman is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is a 65-year-old widow with four children. She runs a small plantation business and her children help out. She joined the SPBD program in 2013 to gain access to financial assistance. With this money, she plans to purchase chemicals, bush knives and a blade sharpener for her business, and cement, paint and carpet for her home improvement. 

Pepe has managed to improve her family's living standards since joining the program and hopes to continue the operation of her plantation business, for it is a good source of income for them.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpner, cement, paint and carpet

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is a 55-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a small plantation and fishing business assisted by her husband and children. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than two years, gaining access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, bush knives and old tires for her plantation business, and fishing nets, spears and kerosene for her fishing business. Lolina has managed to improve her family's living standards with the profits she has been getting from her business and hopes to maintain its continuation, for it is providing them with good income.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, bush knives, old tires, fishing nets, spears and kerosene

loans.name: Karen Mae

texts.en:
Karen Mae  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2014, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). This loan is intended to purchase firewood to resell.

Karen Mae dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to resell

loans.name: Fuaselau

texts.en:
Fuaselau is a 35-year-old married woman with 4 children. She runs a plantation and bakery business and sells to her community and public. 

She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 4 years to gain access to financial assistance.  Fuaselau plans to use the money to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, taro roots for her plantation business, iron roofing, timber, nails, screen wire, flour, cooking oil, soya and a new oven for her biscuit baking business. 

Fuaselau has managed to improve the wellbeing of her family from the profits  and hopes to maintain these businesses.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, taro roots, iron roofing, timber, nails, screen wire, flour, cookig oil, soya, and onions.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito joined Paglaum MPC in the year 2009 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers. 

Aside from copra buying, she also engages in rice retailing. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP. This loan is intended to purchase palay (pre-husked rice) for her rice retailing. 

Charito dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase palay.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo runs a general store in his community to make a living. For many years in this business, he was able to sustain his basic needs and he repaid successfully his previous loan used for buying goods to sell. Improving his business becomes easier with his access to microfinance services of GDMPC.

To improve sales, he took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to sell.

He is hopeful to improve and expand his business to have a better source of income for his family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda has been working in her own farm that grows rice for the family's consumption and sells a portion for their daily needs. Her husband works as a laborer in the neighborhood, and it adds income for the family. 

She had used her previous loan for improving their house. Luzviminda is happy to say that with GDMPC and its services, it helped her family uplift their living standards. She took a new loan recently to buy grocery goods to sell, for she runs a retail store in their village.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has operated a retail store in her village for more than twelve years.  The business does well to meet the family's needs .

Her previous loan was successfully repaid.  Her ability to conduct more business was improve with the support of GDMPC. Recently, she took a  new loan to purchase more grocery items.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en: Hajara remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Hajara, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hajara  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. She hopes to use the extra income from her increased yield to expand her farmland. With this loan, Hajara is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

However, Murtala  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Murtala.   With this loan, Murtala is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

Like all Babban Gona members, Musa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Musa is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Musa is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Joy,  and  Christopher. Musa’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 40-year-old farmer from Kunkumi. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Haruna said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; bilha, yahaya,  and  ibrahim, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Markus Rabo

texts.en: Markus  Rabo remembers not being able to feed or clothe his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona member. Now, Markus  Rabo, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Markus  Rabo is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, expressed Markus Robo. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai is a 41-year-old woman with two children. She runs a vegetable garden and an ice block business, selling to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than five years, gaining access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase chemicals, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds for her vegetable garden business, and plastic bags, cordial, mango skins, and sugar for her ice block business. 

Faafetai hopes to continue the good management of her businesses so that she can continue to assist in meeting their family's weekly essential needs.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals, fertilizers, vegetable seeds, plastic bags, cordial, mango skins, sugar.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 51 years old and lives in Sto Nino Pagadian. She is married and has three children. 

Josephine has a "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business and earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month doing this work.

She has requested a loan to buy stocks for her business. 

Josephine has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Josephine hopes to have her own boutique.

loans.use: To buy stocks for her "ukay-ukay" (used clothing) business.

location.town: Pagadian-Purok Ferdinand, Santo Nino, Pagadian Cit

loans.name: Chinbat

texts.en:
Chinbat, 36 years old, lives with his wife, daughter and twin boys in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He is a truck driver and works for mining company. His wife is a nurse and works at a hospital. 

Their daughter studies at medical college and the twin boys go to high school. Chinbat  requests a loan of 800,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fee. His daughter is a hardworking student and has a bright future in the medical field. He thinks that his daughter will be a fine doctor and wants to help her achieve that dream.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Isapela

texts.en:
Isapela is a 33-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a vegetable garden that she wishes to sell in order to make money. She wold then start baking pancakes and sell them to her community. 

She recently joined the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. Isapela plans to purchase chemicals, bush knives, and a blade sharpener to improve her vegetable garden business.  She will purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her pancake business. 

Isapela hopes to improve her family's living standards with the profit and reinvest  in her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, bush knives, a blade sharpner, flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Faatoe

texts.en:
Faatoe is a 44-year-old widow with two children. She runs a small plantation business, selling to the members of her community and also to the traveling public. She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than three years now to gain access to financial assistance. 

She plans to use this money to purchase a mist blower, chemicals, and fencing wire to further improve her plantation business. Faatoe hopes to continue the good maintenance of her business, for it is not only a good source of income, but it has also helped her meet their family's weekly essential needs.

loans.use: To purchase a mist blower, chemicals, and fencing wire.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani has been operating a general store for more than six years to make a living. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC. 

Lani took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business to gain more income to improve the general living of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito has faithfully repaid his previous loan which he used for his business. He has operated his own “sari-sari” (variety) store and repacking business for years and earns a good income. He meets all his needs and can help his family at the same time. He is determines to have a better income.

To improve sales, Lolito would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery items to sell. He could purchase additional quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages. He is very thankful  and appreciative  for this assistance.

Lolito hopes for his business to continue to flourish and he dreams of having his own house someday. He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work. He finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 30-year-old farmer from Tafiyau.  As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  40 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Emmanuel is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Linus and  Lovina. Emmanuel’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Musa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Musa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Musa   With this loan, Musa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.name: Michael Markus

Like all Babban Gona members, Michael can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Michael is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Michael is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Fideles, and  Denis. Michael's dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Malevine

texts.en: Malevine is 52 years old and married with 8 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 1 year. Malevine needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She just joined SPBD this year. Malevine will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en: Mr. Damdinsuren, 35 years old, lives with his family in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a trackman at the train station since 2008. His wife sells building materials to local people. Their children go to high school. The apartment they live in has deteriorated over the years and is in need of renovation, so he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy hardwood floors and fiberglass. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where energy is preserved and there will be less costs for energy use.

loans.use: to renovate his apartment for energy efficiency

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun is from the Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province and grows rice in a small farmland  located near her house. She is a mother of two depended children and three married children. She has been a farmer for almost forty years and her average income is  4 USD per day.   

The profit  from farming is not sufficient to make a living.  She wants to send her two sons to Thailand so that they can work in construction. To that end, she  requests a loan to pay for two official passports and transportation fees for her  sons.  She hopes that she could send her sons to Thailand safely and get the high paid jobs there. 

She thanks the lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to purchase 2 passports and pay for transportation costs for her sons.

loans.name: Sinaeeteva

texts.en:
Sinaeeteva is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. She runs a small elei printing business and sells them to the members of her community and general public. 

This is the second year that she has been in the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase fabric, fabric paint, and rubber soles to further improve her elei printing business. 

Sinaeeteva has managed to make improvements in her family's living standards from her business profits. She hopes to continue this business and expand it in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, fabric paint, and rubber soles.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita has been running a beauty salon for more than 12 years, earning well to sustain their living. With her generated income from this business, she was able to repay successfully her previous loan used for services materials. 

Aside from this, she also has a general store that brings better cash inflows to her family. She has been a member of GDMPC for many years and it helps her in improving her ability to engage in business. 

To improve sales, she took a new loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Conchita hopes to gain more income from her business and to maintain her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been engaged in buying and selling medicine and vitamins for more than eight years, and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Mary Rose is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional merchandise to sell, specifically more quantities of medicine, vitamins and products of the same kind to expand her product inventory. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mary Rose dreams of expanding her business. She hopes to give the best for the education of her children. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vitamins to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Taalaigul

texts.ru: Таалайгул 48 лет, разведена, одна воспитывает 3 детей (1 дочь и 2 сына). Образование-высшее педагогическое, однако по специальности она не работает, а с 1996 года занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Таалайгул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство: 3 дойные коровы, 15 овец и 1 лошадь. Также в наличии имеет 1,08 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно выращивает эспорцет. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Таалайгул обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 23,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Таалайгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, что позволит ей улучшить благосостояние семьи, и дать высшее образование дочери, которая в этом году заканчивает школу.
texts.en: Taalaigul is 48 years old, divorced and is raising three children alone (1 daughter and 2 sons). She has a higher education in the field of pedagogy, but she does not work in this profession. Since 1996, she has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Taalaigul's hard work and patient character, she currently has a great farm with 3 dairy cows, 15 sheep and 1 horse. She also has on hand a 1.08 hectare plot of irrigated land on which she annually grows sainfoin. For the further development of her farm, Taalaigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 23,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. Taalaigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. This will allow her to improve the living conditions of her family and give her daughter a higher education, as she is graduating from secondary school this year.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Deiby

texts.es:
Desde que era solo un bebe Deiby ya pasaba una difícil situación y fue quedar huérfano. Solo y a la deriva lo recoge una persona la cual le enseña las labores del campo. 

Hoy en día Deiby tiene 24 años de edad trabaja como operario en un campo de flores, pero añadido a esto tiene un negocio de venta de ganado ubicando sus animales en un terreno prestado por el vecino. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado para mejorar sus ingresos ya que su sueño es poder salir adelante con su hijo de 18 meses de edad por el cual luchara incansablemente por darle un hogar una educación una vida digna y para ello necesita la ayuda de los prestadores para demostrar que  puede ser grande y darle a su hijo lo que nunca tuvo un amor de madre y padre.
texts.en:
Since he was just a baby, Deiby experienced difficult situations and was left as an orphan. He was alone and adrift when he met someone who taught him about farm work. Today, Deiby is 24 and is working as a laborer in a field of flowers. He added selling livestock to this business. He places his animals on land provided by a neighbor.

He applied for a loan for the purchase of livestock to improve his income because his dream is to get ahead with his 18-month-old son. He will work tirelessly to provide a home, education, and a decent life. For this, he needs the help of this loan to demonstrate that he can be trussed to give his child what he never had: the love of a mother and father.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a 35-year-old farmer from Gogarma.  As a Babban Gona member, Haruna, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Haruna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Haruna is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Haruna is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children: Yusha'u and Jummai. Haruna’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en: Rahila is a farmer from Galadima.  As a Babban Gona member, Rahila is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rahila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Rahila is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, she will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Rahila is hopeful about what the future holds; she  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, she will finally be able to afford to educate her children; Joseph,  and  Victor. Rahila’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, she expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica es una hermosa joven de 19 años de edad llena de ganas de trabajar de sueños de progreso de pensamientos en grandes. 

Desde los 18 años empezó confeccionando línea propia de ropa y gracias a un curso que está tomando ha mejorado su producción, estilo y calidad de prendas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de maquinaria industrial que tiene un costo de 3.000.000 de pesos colombianos pero ella ya tiene ahorrados  2 millones con el crédito podrá completar el dinero y obtener su maquinaria muy necesaria para nuevos proyectos que tiene en mente.

Ella a pesar de su edad comenzó a ser la fuente principal de dinero en su hogar colaborando con la comida, el pago de cuentas entre otros y sueña con poder crecer, ser reconocida para emplear personas. 

Para ella es de vital importancia este crédito pues lograra completar el dinero de la maquinaria que necesita y será un apoyo muy grande en su sueño de crecer y hacerse mas reconocida en la ciudad como gran confeccionista.
texts.en:
Yesica is a beautiful 19-year-old full of desire to work with large goals and dreams of progress. 
From the age of 18, she began manufacturing her own clothing line. Thanks to a course that she is taking she has improved her production style and garment quality.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of an industrial machine that costs 3,000,000 Colombian pesos [$1,650] but she already as 2,000,000 [$1,100] saved. The loan will complete the money that she needs to get the machine that is much needed to complete new projects that she has in mind.
Despite her age, she began to be the main source of income in her home, paying for food, bills, and more. She has dream to grow and become recognized for employing people. 
It is important that she gets this loan because she can get the machinery she needs as a big support of her dream to grow and become more recognized as a great manufacturer in her city.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Isiya

texts.en: Isiya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Isiya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Gayus, Jonah, and  Ishaaya. Isiya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Isiya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Isiya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Isiya is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “move to the city with my family”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Laasaga

texts.en:
Laasaga is a 40-year-old married woman. She runs a taxi business and her husband drives their taxi. 

She has been a member of the SPBD program for more than 4 years in order to gain access to financial assistance. Laasaga plans to use this money to purchase new tires, break pad sets, seat covers, and paint to maintain the taxi so that it would continue to be in a serviceable condition.  

Laasaga has managed to improve her family's living condition with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to purchase new tires, break pad sets, seat covers, and paint.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya, 40 years old, lives with her husband and three daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been a  janitor at a hotel since 2010. Her husband has a disability and gets a state pension. Raising three children is financially difficult because her salary can't meet the family needs. Her husband provides a taxi service to local people despite his disability. 

She requests 120,0000 MNT to buy insulated windows and paint. Her house's windows were broken in a recent storm and she wants to improve the outer appearance of her house with paint. Insulated windows will prevent dust from entering  her house and will also help to converse energy and reduce coal usage. Coal burning is the main source of air pollution in Mongolia.

loans.use: to install insulated windows.

loans.name: Dympna

texts.en:
Dympna is 58 years old and married.

Dympna grows vegetables in the Philippines and requests 140,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Dympna has farmed  for four years  and has borrowed four previous times  from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dympna would like to save  money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arbey

texts.es:
Arbey es un muy reconocido distribuidor de calzado en la ciudad de Medellín pues lleva 19 años operando vendiendo  en las calles.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de nuevos estilos de sandalias pues sus clientes se lo requieren y si quiere seguir con su volumen de ventas estable para seguir apoyando incondicionalmente a su hijo de 20 años de edad que está estudiando en la universidad. 

Al ser un proveedor de sandalias tiene que estar cambiando constantemente los estilos si quiere fidelizar los clientes y ya no importa el recorrido que lleves si no la variedad de calzado que tengas pues la competencia es fuerte y el más débil ha tenido que cerrar por falta de ventas. 

Sueña con tener un gran almacén con varios empelados sueño que está poniendo en marcha haciendo cuentas de cuanto necesita para lograr este objetivo y sabe que para ello debe vender u tener capital para darle forma a su sueño por tal motivo requiere el apoyo de los prestadores y aun sabiendo que lleva 5 créditos con un muy buen habito de pago.
texts.en: Arbey, a very well-known footwear distributer in Medellín, has been conducting sales as a street vendor for nineteen years.  He is requesting a loan to purchase new styles of sandals because his customers are requesting them, and he wishes to maintain his stable sales volume so that he can continue unconditionally supporting his 20 year old son who is studying at the university. Being a supplier of sandals, he has to change styles constantly if he wants to retain customer loyalty, and says that no matter what route you take, the variety of shoes you have doesn’t matter because the competition is strong.  The weakest have had to close due to lack of sales. He dreams of having a large store with several employees and has started tallying how much he needs to achieve his goal.  He knows that he must make sales and have capital for his dream to take shape.  For this reason, he needs lenders’ support and knows that he still needs five loans with very good payment history.

loans.use: to purchase assorted sandals.

loans.name: Juan Ángel María

texts.es:
Juan tiene 77 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos, nadie mas depende de él y su esposa le ayuda en las actividades que realiza. 


Juan se dedica a la agricultura, trabaja en esta actividad desde los 7 años y lo aprendió de su padre, siendo la agricultura la principal fuente de ingresos de Juan, y espera enseñársela a sus nietos para que tengan algo con que defenderse algún día.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas ya que se acerca la temporada y quiere tener una excelente producción.

Sus planes a futuro son seguir trabajando mientras Dios se lo permita y que sus hijos siempre lo apoyen ya que él trabaja poco por la edad.
texts.en:
Juan is 77 years old. He is married and has two children who are no longer dependent on him. His wife helps him with his work.

Juan is a farmer. He has worked in this field since he was 7 years old, learning from his father. Agriculture is the main source of income for Juan. He hopes to teach his grandchildren to farm so that they have something to rely upon someday.

The loan will be used to by agricultural inputs that he needs for the season that's approaching. He wants to have an excellent production.

His future plans are the continue working as long as God allows and that his children will help support him because he works less due to his age.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for the new growing season

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a 35-year-old farmer from Galadima Toka.  As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yahaya is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 30 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Yahaya is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Blessing,  and  Meshark. Yahaya’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for sewing, because she and a coworker are making school uniforms for primary school.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio es una persona humilde, pero muy trabajadora que hace 4 años decidió comenzar con su negocio de cría de ganado gracias a los conocimientos que recibió por parte de sus padres. 

Braulio es muy consiente que para iniciar su negocio necesita capital y aún más en el mundo del campo donde los animales, el cuido, y las vacunas son muy costosas razón por la cual solicita un monto especifico en el crédito necesario para la compra de 2 terneros y sus vacunas.

Su principal sueño es poder ser reconocido en el terreno, tener muchos animales y codearse y competir con los principales productores de ganado del sector.
texts.en: Braulio is a humble person but is very hard-working. Four years ago he decided to start his business raising cattle thanks to the knowledge he gained from his parents. Braulio is very conscious that to start a business you need capital, moreover in the countryside where the animals, care and vaccines are very costly. For this reason he has requested a specific amount for the loan to buy 2 cows and get them vaccinated. His main dream is to be recognized in his field, to have many animals and to compete with the main cattle producers in his region.

loans.use: to buy cows. and vaccinate them.

loans.name: Anarkul

texts.ru: Анаркуль, 50 лет, замужем, двое детей, старший сын - фермер, дочь - школьница. У Анаркуль высшее образование, она на протяжении 26 лет работает в школе преподавателем химии и биологии. Также около 17 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки овец на сумму 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день она имеет достаточно большой и прибыльный бизнес, у нее в хозяйстве есть 3 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 1 лошадь и 8 овец, также  имеется земельный надел - 3,15 ГА поливной земли, на 2,50 ГА Анаркуль выращивает пшеницу, на 0,65 ГА - картофель, ячмень и эспарцет. Также Анаркуль имеет неплохой доход от продажи молока и яиц местным жителям, дополнительно она шьет изделия из войлока и продает их туристам. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует откладывать на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Anarkul is 50 years old and married. She has two children - an older son who is a farmer and a daughter who is an elementary school student. Anarkul has a higher education. For the past 26 years, she has been working in a school as a biology and chemistry teacher. Additionally, for about 17 years, she has been practicing crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business with a purchase of sheep in the amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today, she has a sufficiently large and profitable business. She currently has 3 dairy cows, 2 bull calves, 1 horse and 8 sheep on her far. She also has a 3.15 hectare plot of irrigated land of which she uses 2.50 hectares to grow wheat and 0.65 hectares to grow potatoes, barley and sainfoin. Additionally, Anarkul makes a decent income from selling milk and eggs to local residents. Also, she sews items made from felt and sells them to tourists. Her cumulative monthly income is about 12,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Anarkul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. She plans to save the earnings from the loan for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de tan solo 22 años que desde muy joven opto por iniciar  su vida como emprendedor, tiene dos personas a cargo y un gran sueño de montar varias sucursales de sus servicios en todo el barrio pues lo que lo diferencia de las demás personas es el exquisito sabor de su salsa.

Solicita un crédito para ampliar su local, comprando sillas y mesas para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

Con el crédito mejorar el servicio al cliente pues solo vende productos y no facilita donde dirigirlos, por eso tiene el riesgo de no fidelizar sus clientes. 

El crédito para él es de vital importancia pues mejorara, podrá mantener a sus dos empleados y pensara en montar varios sucursales generando más empleo.
texts.en:
Juan is a 22-year-old man that decided at a young age to begin his life as an entrepreneur. He employs two people and has a great dream of opening several branches of his business throughout the neighborhood. What differentiates him from everybody else is the delicious taste of his sauce. 

He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying chairs and tables to provide a better service to his customers. This will allow him to improve his customer service, as he currently only sells products but does not have a sitting area for his customers, which creates the risk of not having customer loyalty. 

The loan is of vital importance to him, as it will improve his business. He will be able to maintain his two employees and continue thinking of opening several branches that would generate more employment.

loans.use: to expand his business by having tables and chairs for his customers.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom, 31 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. To support her family, Sokhom and her husband are working very hard on a rice farm, which she inherited from her parents. Up to now, she has been involving in this career for more than 10 years. The daily income that she can make is USD $5 per day. 

To accelerate her farming process, Sokhom would like to have a plowing machine, yet she can’t afford it. She is applying for a loan from KIVA now to buy a plowing machine and she promises to punctually repay the loan with interest based on the repayment schedule. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine

loans.name: Fabio Nelson

texts.es:
Fabio es un humilde cultivador de hortensias unas hermosas flores que alegran cualquier lugar, pero al ser un campesino es muy difícil salir adelante y solo se estanca con lo que tiene y si llega a perder cultivos por el invierno tiene que pasar varios años para recuperar y lograr poner a tono su empresa.

Al estar en un sitio de difícil acceso pues queda a varias horas de la cabecera municipal para Fabio es una bendición contar con una corporación que llegue hasta su hogar a ofrecerle sus servicios. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como riegos, abonos y otros para mantener sus cultivos y poder proteger sus terrenos del fuerte invierno y los constantes cambios climáticos pues de estos campos depende su familia, su esposa y su hijo de 8 años de edad razón por la cual para Fabio es  muy importante recibir la ayuda de los prestatarios.
texts.en:
Fabio is a humble cultivator of hydrangeas, which are beautiful flowers that bring joy to any setting. But it is very difficult to get ahead as a farmer; and having this crop hinders him because if he loses his flowers in the winter it will take several years for him to recover and be able to put his business back into shape. 

Fabio is in a site that is difficult to reach, as it is several hours from town. For that reason, having a corporation that comes to his home to offer their services is a blessing for Fabio. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of irrigation supplies, fertilizers, and other items, in order to maintain his crops and protect his fields from the harsh winter and the constant climate changes.  His family—his wife and 8-year-old son—depend upon these fields, and that is why receiving the lenders’ help is very important for Fabio.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, soil, and irrigation supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Vilma Antonia

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 31 años de edad, ella es madre soltera de un hijo de 2 años de edad por el cual cada día se levanta con ganas de trabajar,  


Vilma se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias y ropa, ella realiza esta labor desde que su madre le enseñó cuando la llevaba al mercado, además en el trabajo se involucra una hermana de Vilma, y es su única fuente de ingresos. 


El crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería y surtir de mejor manera el inventario de la venta de zapatos y ropa  que tiene en el mercado de la ciudad, de esta forma se le estará ayudando a Vilma para que continúa delante con el negocio y no falten ingresos para el hogar.


Sus planes a futuro son surtir de mejor manera el puesto que actualmente tiene en donde vende calzado y ropa la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos y le gustaría incrementar su inventario de mercadería para satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Vilma is a 31 year old single mother of a two year old child for whom she gets up each day with the desire to work. Vilma works selling shoes, sandals and clothing. She has done this work since her mother taught her when she took her to the market. Vilma's sister is also involved in the business. It is her only source of income.

The loan is needed to buy inventory and to better stock her sales of shoes and clothing that she has in the city's market. In this manner it will help Vilma continue forward with her business and not lack money for her household. Her future plans are to stock her stall as best she can as this is where she sells shoes and clothing which is her principal source of income. She would like to increase her inventory to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a 30-year-old farmer from Galadima Toka.  As a Babban Gona member, Dauda is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Dauda can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Dauda is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Dauda is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Mathias,  and  Bilkisu. Dauda’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a 25-year-old farmer from Daura. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Samaila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Samaila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Samaila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; absolam, blessing,  and  titus., and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Habila

texts.en: Habila is a 25-year-old farmer from Daura. As a Babban Gona member, Habila, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Habila can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Habila is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Habila said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Nehemiah, Yahaya, and Friday, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en: Nafiu remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Nafiu, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Nafiu  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community” expressed Nafiu   With this loan, Nafiu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Pedralin

texts.en:
Pedralin is 42 years old and married.

Pedralin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Pedralin has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Pedralin would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jairo se dedica a la agricultura básicamente es un lechero que cuenta con dos vacas, pero tiene un gran problema y es que la comercializadora que pasa por la vereda comprando la leche la compra a un muy bajo costo les paga 800$ en pesos colombianos por litro lo que es muy bajo y con sus dos vacas no da abasto para sostener a su familia. 

Añadido a eso los costos de los abonos, para el pasto el cuido y las vacunas de los animales son muy costosos pro lo que desespera mente busca ayuda para mejorar sus condiciones. 

Solicita un segundo crédito para la compra de dos vacas lecheras, con las cuales duplicara sus ingresos y tendrá mejores oportunidades para él, su familia, su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Jairo works mainly in agriculture as a dairy farmer, and he has two cows. However, he has a serious problem: the trader who comes through the village buys his milk at a low price, 800 Colombian pesos per litre, which is very low. This doesn't give enough with his two cows to maintain his family. On top of this is the cost of fertiliser, the pasture, the care and the vaccinations for his animals, which are all very expensive, and this is why he is desperately seeking to improve conditions

Jairo is asking for a second loan to buy two dairy cows, with which he will double his income and provide better opportunities for himself, his family, his wife and their son.

loans.use: to buy two cows to improve his economic situation.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en: Yunusa remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yunusa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yunusa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Yunusa   With this loan, Yunusa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Haruna, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. With access to high quality inputs, Haruna can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Haruna.  With this loan, Haruna is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tania Gabriela

texts.es:
Tania tiene 18 años de edad, está soltera y actualmente se encuentra estudiando bachillerato a distancia al cual asiste los días sábados y domingos, ella vive junto a sus padres.  


Tania tiene un negocio de venta de jugos, gaseosas, agua, etc. Negocio en el cual lleva dos años, decidió ponerlo para ayudar económicamente a su familia y además como una meta de superación personal pues quería valerse por si sola, este negocio lo realiza de lunes a viernes ya que los fines de semana estudia.


El Préstamo será invertido para comprar mercadería para su negocio como lo son jugos, gaseosas, agua, etc. ya que menciona que le va bien y quiere diversificar y vender panes o antojitos.

Sus metas son culminar sus estudios de bachillerato y si es posible ingresar a la universidad, pues desea tener un mejor futuro y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Tania is 18 years old, single and is actually studying for her High school diploma by distance learning. She attends classes on Saturday and Sunday. She lives with her parents. Tania has a business selling juice, soft drinks and water, etc. She has been doing this for two years . She decided to open it to help her family economically and also as a goal for personal improvement as she wants to be worthy. She runs the business from Monday to Friday as she studies on the week-ends.

The loan will be invested in buying merchandise for her business like juices, soft drinks, water, etc as she mentions that things are going well for her and she wants to diversify selling breads or snacks. Her goals are to complete her secondary studies and if possible go to university as she wants to have a better future and help her family.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, water, etc for her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Simon, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. With access to high quality inputs, Simon can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family” expressed Simon   With this loan, Simon is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 25-year-old single mother of one child. She has decided to join the SPBD program to gain access to financial assistance so that she will be able to help out with her family's financial needs. Thus, she would like to restock their shop so that they would be able to have a means of earning a profit. With this money, she plans to purchase sacks of sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, sausages, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, etc. 

Christina hopes to make a lot of savings out of the profits she will be getting from the sale of her stock so that she will be able to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar, flour, rice, boxes of canned fish, corned beef, sausages, chicken leg quarters, mutton flaps, etc

loans.name: Gulash

texts.ru: Гулаш 60 лет, вдова, после смерти супруга в 2012 году, она проживает с сыном и его семьей, помогает воспитывать внуков. У Гулаш среднее образование, много лет проработала в табак совхозе, сейчас на заслуженной пенсии, занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур – перца и многолетних трав на 2,0 ГА поливной земли. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 дойные коровы и 3 теленка. Вся семья с радостью помогает Гулаш в ведении ее бизнеса. Гулаш реализует молоко и молочную продукцию местным жителям. Так как вся деятельность Гулаш  экологичная, домашняя и чрезвычайно вкусная, она пользуется большим спросом и число покупателей растет с каждым днем. Поэтому Гулаш  и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение доходов от продажи молока, за счет покупки дойной коровы с теленком. Доходы от кредита Гулаш планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulash is a 60 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband in 2012, she has been living with her son and his family, where she helps look after the grandchildren. Gulash has a secondary education. For many years, she worked in state tobacco farm. Now that she has earned her pension, she practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She grows peppers and perennial grasses on a 2.0 hectare plot of irrigated land. She also has 2 dairy cows and 3 calves on her farm. Her entire family enjoys helping her run her business. Gulash sells milk and dairy products to local residents. As all of Gulash's enterprises are eco-friendly, homemade and exceptionally delicious, there is a high demand for her products and her number of customers grows every day. This is why Gulash turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to increase her income from the sale of milk, specifically by buying a dairy cow with a calf. Gulash plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow with a calf to enable her to produce and sell more dairy products.

loans.name: Thelma Zuleyma

texts.es:
Thelma tiene 20 años de edad, culminó sus estudios de bachillerato hace tres años, actualmente vive junto a sus abuelos y se dedica a cuidarlos.  


Esta joven solamente se dedica a los oficios domésticos ya que tiene que cuidar a sus abuelos que son de avanzada edad, su padre le ayuda económicamente a Thelma.


Ella necesita el crédito para mejorar la vivienda donde habita con sus abuelos ya que una parte del techo está en mal estado y es por ello que necesita muchísimo de esta ayuda. 

Sus planes a futuro son seguir estudiando, pero sin descuidar a sus abuelos que son las personas con quien más ha compartido gran parte de su infancia, además ella quiere formar su propia familia y tener sus hijos e inculcarle los valores que sus abuelos le han ensañado a ella.
texts.en:
Thelma is 20 years old and completed her secondary studies three years ago. Today she lives with her grandparents and works taking care of them. This young woman only does the domestic work as she has to care for her grandparents who are quite old. Her father helps her economically.

Thelma needs the loan to make improvements on the house where she lives with her grandparents as part of the roof is in bad shape. So she needs this assistance greatly. Her plans for the future are to continue studying but without neglecting her grandparents who are the people she spent much of her childhood with. She also wants to have her own family and have children and instil in them the values that her grandparents taught her.

loans.use: to make improvements on the house she lives in as the roof is in bad shape.

loans.name: Wilson Omar

texts.es: A sus 28 años de edad Omar es un joven trabajador, el se dedica al jornal y a la crianza de terneros, Omar vive solamente con su hermano de 12 años ya que su madre los abandono hace 3 años para irse a vivir con otro señor, Omar va a invertir el crédito en la compra de  terneros, de este negocio aspira seguirse ayudando para que nada les haga falta a él y su hermano.
texts.en: At the age of 28 Omar is a hard-working man. He works as day labor and raising calves. Omar lives alone with his brother who is 12 years old. Their mother abandoned them three years ago to go and live with another man. Omar will invest the loan buying calves. With this business he hopes to continue to work so that he and his brother don't lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Садриддин преподаватель и работает в средней школе своего района Бохтар. Он преподает там в течение 8 лет. Одновременно он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота у себя во дворе дома. 
Садриддин женатый человек. Ему 48 лет. Он отец троих детей. Одна его дочь является студенткой второго курса Медицинского колледжа города Кургантюбе. Она прилежно учиться, так как ей нравится ее будущая профессия. Садриддин обратился за кредитом для оплаты за второй курс обучения дочери в колледже. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку, так как у него нет достаточного сбережения и обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своих двух работ.
texts.en: Sadriddin is a teacher and works at a secondary school in the Bohtar District. He has been teaching there for the past 8 years. Simultaneously, he raises cattle in the yard outside his house. Sadriddin is a married man. He is 48 years old. He is the father of three children. One of them, his daughter, is a second-year student at the Kurgan-Tyube Medical College. She studies diligently, as she likes her future profession. Sadriddin requested a loan to pay for his daughter's second year tuition at the Medical College. He relies on this financial support, as he does not have sufficient savings. He promises to pay back the loan on time using the earnings from his two jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's second year tuition at the Medical College.

loans.name: Marío Alfredo

texts.es:
Mario tiene 36 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañado desde hace 10 años y junto a su compañera de vida tienen su negocio familiar.


Mario tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y utensilios de primera necesidad para el hogar, del cual también es propietaria su compañera de vida, decidieron emprender este negocio debido a que Mario no encontraba trabajo y su pareja lo apoyó, ambos visitan cantones y municipios más cercanos ya que su venta es casa por casa la cual lo hacen de lunes a viernes.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar más mercadería para el negocio de ropa y así ofrecer más variedad y estilos.

Su plan a futuro es colocar su negocio en un lugar fijo para ya no tener que trasladarse a vender a otros lugares.
texts.en:
Mario is 36 years old, and he studied until the sixth grade.  He has lived with his life companion for 10 years, and together they have their family business. 

Mario and his life companion have a business, selling clothing and basic household utensils. They decided to start this business because Mario was unable to find work, and his wife supported him. They both visit the closest cantons and towns, as they make their sales by going door-to-door Monday through Friday.

He needs the loan in order to purchase more merchandise for his clothing business, and thus offer more variety and styles. His plan for the future is to put his business in a fixed location so that he will no longer have to travel to other places to make sales.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for his clothing business, and thus offer more variety and styles.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a 40-year-old farmer from Daura.  As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Musa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Musa is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least  35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Musa is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children:  Joy, Clopas, Jona, and Meshech. Musa’s dreams do not end here: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he said.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is 44 years old and a married man who has three married children and two dependent children. He lives in the Svay Antor District of Prey Veng Province. To earn a living, Sari and his wife manage a rice farming business which is the sole source of their income. So far, they have been in this occupation for almost 20 years with an average income of USD $10 a day. 

Sari wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in his house now. Therefore, he is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, he can help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Soem

texts.en:
Soem, 61 years old, is a hardworking rice farmer in Svay Antor district, Prey Veng province. He has four children who are already married. Soem and his wife manage and operate rice farmland, which is located just behind their house. So far, it has been almost forty years for them being farmers. The earning that this couple can generate is USD 8.00 a day each. 

Soem wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Due to inadequate funds, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, Soem hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. Soem is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him with a special interest rate, lower than its general loan rates. Soem awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира живет в отдаленном регионе. Она родилась в 1977 году. Замира замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж мастер по ремонту автомашин. Она 10 лет назад начала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она успешно развевает свой бизнес, так как в ее районе конкуренция не очень большая. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как доход ее мужа маленькая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки и тканей для увеличения оборотного капитала. С полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить детей хорошим образованием. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zamira lives in a remote district. She was born in 1977. Zamira is married and is raising three children. Her husband is an expert auto-mechanic. Ten years ago, she started her own business of sewing women's clothing. She offers her services out of her home. She is successfully developing her business, as there is not a lot of competition in her district. She is the main provider for her family, as her husband has a small income. She is requesting a loan for 7,500 somoni to buy a sewing machine and fabric to increase her working capital. With the earned income, she plans to provide her children with a good education. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie has managed her farm for many years to make a living. She used to harvest coconut and vegetables from the farm and sell the farm products in town. She successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for farming. She always finds ways to improve her farm and with her access to GDMPC, it will become more possible. 

Recently, Rosemarie took a loan to cover weeding maintenance costs and fertilization. Her future plan is to replant coconut on the farm and grow bananas as another crop to gain more income for her family.

loans.use: to cover weeding maintenance costs and fertilization.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is from the village of  Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. A 31-year-old, Doris is married and has three children. While her husband is working as a government employee, she operates a service-based business offering motorcycle rentals in their community to earn extra income to support her family too.  

Recently, she took a new loan to cover license renewals and registration of her vehicles used in the business. She wants to have a better living condition in the near future with her family and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to cover license renewal and registration of her vehicles

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is married with five children. She operates a fishing business to make a living. She has been in this field of business for more than a year, and she earns well to provide for her family. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more varieties of fish to sell. In the future, Juvelyn wants to own a stall in the market in town where they could vend fish. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of fish to sell

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She has boost her income and has also improved the general living condition of her family.

Nida would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and various hanging plants.

In the future, Nida hopes that her business will continue to operate and grow smoothly. She dreams for her family to be always healthy and prosperous in all things. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer, for her business

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
