Jennelyn owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan that was used for the business. She has also improved her income and the general living conditions of her family.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 20,000 to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Jennelyn wants to make improvements to her business and open branches of it. She also dreams of well-off living for her family. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edleyn

texts.en:
Edleyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edleyn is 34 years old and both of her children are in school.

Edleyn has a motorcycle repair business in the Philippines. Edleyn requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her motorcycle repair shop.

Edleyn has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Edleyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old, married and has three children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Annie has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annie has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: John D.

texts.en: John D is a Babban Gona farmer member. John D expressed that he is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led John D to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, John D can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, John D is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 40 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, John D will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what  plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to provide more food and clothing for my family”. With this loan, John D will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Hadicha

texts.ru: Хадича, 53 года, замужем, есть сын. Хадича в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи на протяжении 24 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Хадичи в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 коров, 10 овец, 1 лошадь, также есть 1,0 ГА земли с посевом зерновых культур, ежемесячный доход от реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции и молока составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Хадича обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 3 бычков. Доходы от кредита Хадича планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также хочет приобрести автомобиль для сына.
texts.en: Hadicha is 53 years old, married, and has a son. As the main source of income for her family, Hadicha has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for the past 24 years. Thanks to Hadicha's hard work, she currently has 6 cows, 10 sheep and 1 horse on her farm, as well as a 1.0 hectare plot of land on which she grows grains. Her average monthly income from the sale of crops and milk is 8,000 som (KGS). For the further development of her business, Hadicha turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by purchasing three bull calves. Hadicha plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also wants to buy a car for her son.

loans.use: to purchase three bull calves.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old farmer from Ung/Daura.  As a Babban Gona member, Joseph , is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Joseph can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Joseph is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Joseph said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Julius, Anthony, and  Lobina, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина работает кассиром в банке Аваль. Живет в Киевской области вместе с мужем и взрослым сыном. У них есть свой дом в хорошем месте, недалеко от леса. Ремонт в доме семья начала уже давно, много работы было сделано. Осталось доделать совсем немного прежде чем семья сможет наслаждаться полноценным уютом и отдыхом. 
Сумма в 20 000 гривен нужна Ирине для того, чтобы улучшить дома жилищные условия, а именно установить 3 двери, ванну, сделать ремонт туалета, заменить канализационные трубы, облицевать стены и пол керамической плиткой.
texts.en:
Irina works as a bank teller at Aval Bank. She lives in Kiev province with her husband and their adult son. They have their own home in a great location not far from a forest. She started renovating her home a long time ago and a lot of work has been accomplished. There is not that much that remains to be done before the family will be able to completely relax in comfort.

Irina needs 20,000 hryvnia (UAH) to improve her living conditions, specifically to put in three doors, a bath tub, repair the toilet, change out the sewage pipes, and resurface the walls and floor with ceramic tiles.

loans.use: to put in three doors, a bath tub, repair the toilet, change out the sewage pipes, and resurface the walls and floor with ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea is 22 years old and she is from Tarlac City. She is taking up Food and beverage Services in St. Paul College of Tarlac. She chose this course because it is in demand abroad. It is her dream to finish college, despite the fact that they struggle financially. To support her studies, she wants to request an educational loan of PHP 10,000 from the KIVA lenders. She is hopeful that the lenders will approve her loan.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Marie June

texts.en:
Marie June is a married entrepreneur who operates a general store to make a living. In addition, she sells barbecue to earn extra income. 

For three years of running the business, she earns well to support the needs of her family and has been able to sustain it. She has now borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Narlie

texts.en:
Narlie owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan that was used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income, like managing their farm business, to help provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 8,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of a franchise agreement/permit so she can continue her business operations.

In the future, Narlie wants to buy another tricycle unit. She hopes to improve the family's general living conditions and that her children will manage to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 29 years old and she is from Tarlac City. She is taking up Front Office Services at St. Paul College of technology. She has one child and she works as a sales representative in real estate. She wants to finish college so she has something to be proud of and so that she can go abroad and be able to support her child. 

To help her efforts, she wants to seek PHP 10,000 financial assistance from the KIVA lenders. She hopes that the lenders will approve her loan because this will be a big help to her future and to her child as well.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic lives at Amulung with her family. She has four children and her third child is in college education. She only operates a grocery store for income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for the tuition fees and allowance for her child. She hopes that this will be approved as payment is required for the tuition fees and allowances. Her child aims to become successful someday and help the family alleviate poverty.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowance for her child.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 58 years old, married and has five children.

Elma is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elma has been farming vegetables for five years, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Denis

texts.ru:
Денис живет под Киевом. Занимается продажей металлических и деревянных дверей, металлопластиковых изделий. У Дениса три торговых точки, одна на центральном рынке, еще две — в разных районах города. Одна торговая точка располагается в собственном доме, две других — в арендованных помещениях. В бизнесе занят 6 лет. Цены на товар достаточно низкие. 
Денис надеется использовать полученные от КИВА средства в размере 30 000 гривен для того, чтобы расширить количество и ассортимент товара, так как планирует расширение торговой площади. Полученную прибыль Денис намерен использовать для того, чтобы закупить двери для нового выставочного зала в 200 квадратных метров. Он целенаправленно намерен расширять свое дело, арендуя новые торговые площади.
texts.en:
Denis lives in the suburbs of Kiev. He sells metal and wooden doors, as well as reinforced plastic items. Denis has three selling stalls - one in the central market and another two in different neighborhoods of the city. One of his retail locations is located in his own home, while the other two are in rented premises. He has been in this business for 6 years. The price for the merchandise is sufficiently low.

Denis hopes to use a 30,000 hryvnia (UAH) KIVA loan to expand the number and variety of his merchandise, as he plans to expand his retail floor space. Denis is determined to use the received income to buy doors for a new, 200 square kilometer, exhibition hall. He very intent on expanding his business by renting new selling space.

loans.use: to increase and diversify his merchandise.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es una mujer de 48 años de edad soltera, madre de tres hijos y se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ella es una persona luchadora, emprendedora, nunca se queda quieta, siempre busca que los demás estén contentos y siempre muy trabajadora, su negocio de venta de comida ambulante lo realiza en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El alto (ferias como: Senkata, San Martín, Tilata, 16 de julio, etc.) , estas ferias generan un importante sector de servicios pequeños que las personas aprovechan como ser: venta de animales menores, ventas de productos, venta de artesanías, y venta de comida entre otros.
Mery es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana. Apenas sale el sol Mery ya se alista para dirigirse a la feria zonal que en esta jornada le toca, una olla con papas previamente hervidas, tomates, cebollas, arroz cocido, carne cocida, pollo cocido y ahogado (cebolla cocida) deben entrar en su carrito bien sujetos para que no se caigan en las 20 cuadras que restan hasta llegar a la zona ferial. Una vez en el lugar arma su toldo (sombrilla) y coloca su pizarra donde escribe el menú del día y los precios. En la mayoría de las zonas este es el panorama dos o tres veces a la semana.
Mery quiere tener un puesto fijo de venta, haciendo la compra de un kiosco para ampliar el mercado de su negocio, con un lugar fijo y estable, su sueño es realizar la venta de comida en varios puestos fijos.
Es por esos motivos que Mery solicita un préstamo para la compra de un kiosco y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mery is a 48-year-old single woman with three children. Her occupation is the sale of food. She is a tenacious and entrepreneurial person who is always trying to make everybody happy and works very hard. She sells food in different street markets in the city of El Alto (markets such as Senkata, San Martin, Tilata, 16 de Julio, etc.). These markets support an important small business sector, which includes the sale of small animals, products, handcrafts and food, among others.

Mery has olive skin, long black hair and an average height. As soon as the sun rises, Mery gets ready to go to one of the city markets. A pot with boiled potatoes, tomatoes, onion, rice, beef, chicken and "ahogado" (cooked onion) must be well placed in her cart so these items do not fall during the 20-block trip to the market area. Once she arrives, she sets up her awning and a board where she writes the daily menu with prices. Mery wants to buy a kiosk to expand her business' market by having a stable and permanent place to sell food. Her dream is to sell food in several permanent kiosks.

This is why Mery is requesting a loan to buy a kiosk and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk and achieve her dream of having a permanent place to sell her food.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 54 years old, married and has five children. She is raising hogs to sell as a source of income. Her spouse is a tricycle driver. Myrna would like to help all her children to achieve their dreams. Her fourth child, Marjhon, is taking up Human Kinetics and wants to become successful in his chosen career someday. Myrna wants to continue sending him to school, that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition fees and allowances for her child. She promises to pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and allowance for her child.

loans.name: Teuila

texts.en:
Teuila is a 35-year-old married woman with three children. She runs a small vegetable garden business, selling her vegetables not only to the people of her community but also to the public at the market. She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. 

With this loan, Teuila plans to purchase vegetable seeds, a mist blower and chemicals to improve her vegetable garden. Teuila hopes to make a lot of profit out of her business so she would not only be able to improve her family's living standards, but also to assist in her family's weekly financial obligations.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, a mist blower and chemicals

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей работает пограничником-контрактником в своем родном городке Берегово. Вместе с женой и годовалой дочкой живет в двухкомнатной квартире пятиэтажного дома. Так как эти дома старые, побелка там давно потрескалась, Сергей давно подумывал о том, чтобы как-то улучшить жилищную обстановку семьи и создать более комфортные условия для жизни своей семьи.  
Сергей хочет сделать небольшой ремонт, побелить стены в кухне, прихожей и в комнатах. Для этого ему понадобятся 20 000 гривен.
texts.en: Sergei works as a contract border guard in his hometown of Beregovo. He lives with his wife and one-year-old daughter in a two-room apartment in a five-story building. As these buildings are old, the whitewashing has long since chipped off the walls. Sergei has long been thinking about somehow improving his family's living conditions and making their residence more comfortable for his family to live in. Sergei wants to do a small renovation, namely whitewashing the walls in the kitchen, hallway and in the rooms. He needs 20,000 hryvnia (UAH) for this project.

loans.use: to whitewash the walls in in his kitchen, hallway and rooms.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKOLA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Fala Sidibela, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments et de céréales. 
Les femmes du groupe BENKOLA sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à Soro Yiriwaso.
La cliente MARAMOU SEYDOU, personne assise est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de grain de néré, de la feuille de baobab séché et du sel chez les grossistes à Dioïla. 
La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 12 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkola group is composed of married women averaging 37 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in Fala Sidibela, Diola Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell condiments and cereals. The group members are on their ninth solidarity loan.

In order to meet the huge customer demand, they have reached out to Soro Yiriwaso.
Our client Maramou Seydou, the one seated [in the photo], is illiterate. She currently works as a vegetable vendor. She plans to buy two bags of néré nuts [locust tree seeds], dried baobab leaves and salt from wholesalers in Diola. She sells retail, for cash, out of her home and at the market, to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 12,000 West African francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Ana Loraine

texts.en: Ana Loraine, 19, is a single student studying Hospitality and Industry Management. She is in her second year now. Her mother is a food vendor while her father is a farmer. This is how they get income for the family's sustenance. Ana Loraine would like to continue her education and finish her degree, but her parents have insufficient fund to sustain all her school needs. She is now asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay her tuition fees. If Ana Loraine finishes her education, she will get a good-paying job and will able to help lift her family out of poverty someday.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James managed a banana farm in order to make a living. He also worked in a private institution as a collector and it helped his family to sustain their needs. 

James had successfully repaid his previous loan used for farming. Improving his farm is his plan for he wants to ensure a better source of income for the family. He is preparing for a better future for his children. 

With his income, James was able to begin a business selling grocery goods in their village. He has been running it for more than a year with the help of his wife. Recently, he took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. He wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es:
Hernando toda la vida se ha dedicado a la ebanistería pero en su último empleo decidió iniciar un venta de comida rápidas pero debido a que en su trabajo le tocada trabajar horas extras le toco tomar una difícil decisión de seguir con la profesión que toda la vida le ha dado de comer o adentrarse en el mundo del emprendimiento. 

Hernando es padre de 2 hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad y vive con su pareja los cuales dependen netamente de él. 

Con mucho miedo pero con fortaleza y determinación en su decisión El señor Hernando quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar una carpa para proteger a sus clientes de las lluvias y del sol, mejorar su carro de comida y comprar insumos. 


El crédito será de gran importancia pues ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y será un apoyo para Hernando para asegurar que el emprendimiento fue la mejor decisión de su vida.
texts.en:
Hernando has devoted himself to woodworking all of his life, but in his last employment, he decided to start a fast food business. However, his job required him to work extra hours, so he had to make a difficult decision: to continue with the profession that had put food on the table all his life, or enter into the world of entrepreneurship.

Hernando lives with his wife and his 2 children, ages 14 and 17. They depend upon him very much.  With great trepidation but also with strength and resolve, Señor Hernando has made his decision.   He wants to request a loan in order to purchase a tent to protect his customers from the rain and the sun, improve his foot cart, and buy supplies.

The loan will be of great importance, as it will help him to strengthen his business, and it will be a support for Hernando in order to ensure that entrepreneurship was the best decision of his life.

loans.use: to purchase a tent, improve his food cart, and purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Salaneta

texts.en:
Salaneta is 53 years old and married with seven children. She has a large plantation and sells her produce to members of her community and to the public. To earn some extra income, she also runs a small fishing enterprise where she sells fish to the local supermarkets. She has been doing this for eight year,s and it has been the backbone to her success. 

Salaneta needs a loan to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, two new wheelbarrows, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade for her farm. For her fishing business, she'll also be buying a new canoe, a large cooler and bags of ice. She has been a member of SPBD since 2006. Salaneta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly essential needs.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals, fertilizer, two new wheelbarrows, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade for her farm, as well as a new canoe, a large cooler and bags of ice for her fishing business

loans.name: Blanca Cristela

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 28 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, su pareja anterior lamentablemente falleció pero ella ahora ha decidido rehacer su vida con otra persona.

Blanca trabaja como empleada en una escuela del cantón, ella cuida a los niños que son menores de 5 años de edad, ya tiene dos años en esta actividad y solo lo hace por las mañanas, por la tarde se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y el trabajo le queda a 5 minutos de su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para  la reparación  de la vivienda de sus padres pues el techo se está deteriorando y necesita ser reparado.


Sus sueños son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios académicos y logren alcanzar una carrera universitaria pero sobre todo que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Blanca is 28 years old and completed up to ninth grade at school. She has a partner and two children. Blanca's former partner sadly died but she has decided to start a new life with somebody else.

Blanca works at a local school looking after children younger than five years old. Blanca has been doing this work for two years, working only in the mornings. In the afternoon she takes care of the household chores. Blanca's work is five minutes away from her home.

This loan will be used to make repairs to her parents' home, where the condition of the roof has deteriorated.

Blanca's dreams are for her children to finish school and good to university. Above all, she wants them to be good people.

loans.use: to make repairs to her parents' home, where the condition of the roof has deteriorated.

loans.name: Evelin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evelin tiene 24 años de edad, estudió hasta básica en la escuela de su comunidad, por hoy está estudiando el bachillerato en un pueblo y estudia los fines de semana, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura es quien lleva el sustento al hogar, tienen dos hijos el más grande estudia tercer grado la niña más pequeña no asiste a la escuela. 

Ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar, también cuida cerdos y gallinas todo esto lo hace desde pequeña cuando estaba en casa de sus padres, fueron ellos mismos los que le enseñaron todo respecto al trabajo de la casa y la responsabilidades que adquiría al formar su propio hogar, no tiene más actividades que realice, siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza, su horario de trabajo es desde las 5:00 am a 7:00 pm que termina.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar puertas para su casa ya que están terminando de construirla y no les alcanzó el dinero para comprar las puertas.

Sus sueños a futuro son terminar de estudiar bachillerado y cuidar siempre a su familia, espera preparar a sus hijos en el estudio.
texts.en:
Evelin is 24 years old and went only to primary school in the local community. She is now studying for her high school degree in a nearby town at the weekends. Evelin is married; her husband is a farmer and supports the household. The couple has two children: the eldest is in third grade at school while the youngest - a girl - is not in school.

Evelin is a housewife. She also looks after pigs and hens. She has been doing this work since she was a girl living with her parents. Indeed it was her parents who taught her to do household chores and run her own home. Evelin has no other jobs as she already looks after the household and animals. Evelin works from 5am until 7pm.

Evelin needs a loan in order to buy doors; the house is nearly finished being built and she does not have enough money to buy the doors.

Evelin's dreams are to obtain her high school degree and look after her family. She hopes to prepare her children for their education.

loans.use: to buy doors; the house is nearly finished being built and Evelin does not have enough money to buy the doors.

loans.name: Julie Amie

texts.en:
Julie Amie is 40 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school.

Julie Amie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Julie Amie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Julie Amie has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Julie Amie would like to save enough money to expand her business in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Halima joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: . Halima is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Halima will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, she would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Halima can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Halima said “I plan to use the money I make this year to build a better home. Halima is not thinking about just this year alone; she said, ultimately, she  wants to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ibrashim

texts.en: Ibrashim is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ibrashim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Jona, Amos,  and  Yonana. Ibrashim is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ibrashim will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ibrashim can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ibrashim said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family. Ibrashim is not thinking about just this year; he said, In 5 years, he  wants to ensure my children are in good schools and well fed.”

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга — из Виноградово. Она работает в компании Аутомотив Украина в должности уборщицы. Работает 4 года. Ольга замужем, у нее 4 детей, живут в собственном доме. 
Ольга давно мечтает расширить свою жилплощадь, потому что ее большой семье очень трудно жить в доме, который у них есть, состоящем всего их двух комнат. Получив от КИВА сумму в 10 000 гривен, Ольга надеется сделать пристройку из двух комнат возле дома.
texts.en: Olga is from Vinogradovo and has been a cleaner for Ukraine Automotive for four years. She is married with four children and owns her home. Olga has dreamed for a long time of expanding their living space because it is difficult for a large family to live in a house that only has two rooms. With a 10,000 hryvnia Kiva loan, Olga hopes to add two rooms to the house.

loans.use: to build an addition on her house

loans.name: Maria Daniela

texts.es: Daniela vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas de 4 y 8 años que se encuentran estudiando, Daniela se dedica a la crianza de ganado, el tiene su terneros y vaconas en terrenos arrendados, son 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad, su esposo trabaja de cocinero en un restaurante, Daniela va a comprar ganado para criar y de ahí apoyar a su  esposo con los gastos del hogar, y sobre todo para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en: Daniela lives with her husband and her two daughters, 4 and 8 years old, who attend school. Daniela makes a living by breeding cattle. She has her calves and cows on leased lands. It has been five years since she has been doing this activity. Her husband works as a cook in a restaurant. Daniela is going to purchase cattle to raise and from that support her husband with the home expenses and, above all, the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ishaya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Joseph, Rudah, and  Deborah. Ishaya is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ishaya will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ishaya can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Ishaya is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Nur

texts.en:
Nur is a student candidate at the Academy Maritime Nusantara (AMN) who will study marine engineering. Nur lives in a village on the outskirts of the city of Cilacap. Nur had just graduated from high school and wants to continue his studies at AMN. He expects to complete the program of study, but he has concerns about the cost of his studies. 

Nur's parents work as regular employees with minimal income, so it is difficult to finance his studies. There are two siblings who need a lot of costs to complete their schooling. Nur is willing to work on a ship as a ship’s engineer professional because this is his dream from long ago. However, Nur understands the economic conditions of his parents, because the parents have to pay for his siblings’ schools. 

Nur wants to get a loan from Kiva to pay for college fees so that he can complete his studies, get a job quickly and can help his younger siblings achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: G.s Enmanuel Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana es una mujer  emprendedora y dedicada a su negocio propio que es venta de abarrotería en general, desde hace 1 año, actividad que realiza de forma domiciliar, su negocio está ubicado en un punto estratégico donde transitan muchas personas y además esta a esquina opuesta a un colegio por el cual tiene más clientes que la visitan.
Doña Ana se levanta muy temprano para atender su negocio esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de pollo, arroz, café, azúcar, leche, café, aguas, queso, aceite, papel higiénico, etc. para surtir mas su negocio, espera que esta inversión le permita obtener los ingresos necesarios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Ana uno de sus sueños es que atreves de las ganancias que obtenga su hija pueda seguir estudiando, está solicitando el préstamo de forma grupal y en la foto sale una señora que es muy amiga del grupo pero no esta solicitando prestamo.
Doña Karla se dedica a la venta de comidas, sopa de mondongo, yuca con chicharrones, nacatamales, refrescos naturales, de mora, pozol, y vasitos de leche con coco desde hace 4 años.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de abarrotería desde hace 1 año.
Don Héctor se dedica a la venta de plásticos pailas, vasos, canastas y aretes de fantasía desde hace 1 año. 

Danlí, Honduras – Junio 2014
texts.en:
Ana is a hard-working woman. For the past year, she has been devoted to her own business, which is selling groceries. She set up her business out of her home. It is located at a strategic spot, where there is a lot of foot traffic. Moreover, it is at the opposite corner of a school. This is why she has more visiting customers.

Ana gets up very early in the morning to tend to her business. She is requesting a loan to buy chicken, rice, coffee, sugar, milk, water, cheese, oil, toilet paper, and the like to increase her business stock. She hopes that this investment will allow her to obtain the necessary income to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

One of Ana’s dreams is to use the profits that she makes to help her daughter continue with her studies. She is part of a group requesting a loan. In the photo appears a lady, who is a very good friend of the group but is not requesting a loan.

Over the past four years, Karla has been making a living selling food: mondongo [tripe] soup, yucca with cracklings, Nicaraguan tamales, natural soft drinks (blackberry), pozol [traditional drink from southern Mexico, made from ground cornmeal and cacao], and small glasses of milk with coconut.

For the past year, María has been making a living selling groceries.

For the past year, Héctor has been making a living selling plastic products, containers, glasses, baskets, and imitation jewellery earrings.

Danlí, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, coffee, sugar, milk, water, cheese, oil, toilet paper, and the like for her business.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar por los recursos económicos, está casada y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos asisten a la escuela y el mas pequeño todavía no, su esposo es fontanero y nadie más vive con ellos.

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, y en su casa vende charamuscas y churros, decidió dedicarse a esto por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, en ocasiones Ángela sale a vender a una cancha cuando hay partidos de fútbol.


El crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para abonar la milpa que ha sembrado su esposo, comprará 2 sacos de abono, además invertirá en su negocio y comprará bolsas de churros, jugos y gaseosas. 

Su deseo  es que dios les de salud a su familia y que le permita continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
Angela is 32 years old; she went to high school but couldn’t continue studying because of economical reasons. She is married and has three children: two of them go to school and the smallest one not yet. Her husband is a plumber. Nobody else lives with them. 

She spends her time doing the domestic chores, and in her home she sells peanut caramels and churros (fried doughnuts). She decided to make a living from these out of the necessity to help her husband with the expenses. Sometimes Angela goes out to a soccer field to sell (when there is a match). 

She needs the loan she is requesting to fertilize the cornfields that she has planted with her husband. She will purchase two sacks of fertilizer, and she will also invest in her business and purchase bags of churros, juices, and sodas. 

Her wish is for God to give her family health, and that he allows her to keep working.

loans.use: To fertilize the cornfield her husband has planted, she will purchase 2 bags of fertilizer. She will also in invest in her business and purchase bags of churros (fried pastry), juices, and sodas.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is 54 years old and has six children, one of whom is still in school. She is married.

Maria Luz is in the poultry business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional chickens, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Maria Luz has been in poultry for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maria Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional chickens, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 38 years old and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is married.

Maribeth is in the agricultural business, selling goats in the Philippines. She requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional goats and other supplies for her business.

Maribeth has been buying and selling goats for four years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goats and other supplies

loans.name: Winda Pradana Ario

texts.en:
Winda is registered as a current student who will study the nautical program at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara (AMN). He comes from a small village on the outskirts of the town, precisely in the village of Majenang. Winda is the third child of three brothers. His father works as a security guard at a factory, with minimal income. 

Given the economic conditions of the family were not enough, and his two siblings are also still at school, Winda is eager to get a student loan from Kiva. The hope of Winda is that by obtaining a loan from Kiva, he can continue his studies. His dream to become a professional sailor can be realized in order to help both parents. 

Winda is grateful to Kiva lenders, who have given help to make it easy for him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Rahilla

texts.en: Rahilla is a 35-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako. As a Babban Gona member, Rahilla, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Rahilla can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Rahilla is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 38 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give her access to inputs that will positively impact the soil health of her field. When asked how she plans to use the money she will make from selling her harvest, Rahilla said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Titus, Parasser,  and  Lidiya. Ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Abdullahi

texts.en: Abdullahi is a Babban Gona farmer from Mabuga. Abdullahi expressed that he is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is the desire to fulfil this ambition that led Abdullahi to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Abdullahi can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Abdullahi, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season. By doing so, Abdullahi will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what he plans to do with his income from this season, he said: “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland”. With this loan, Abdullahi will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Irene

texts.pt: A Senhora Irene é casada e vive com o esposo, um filho, e quatro netos. O esposo é carpinteiro Ela é operária. Com o presente empréstimo quer adquirir material de construção para fazer casas de banho em melhores condições. Tem  sonho de abrir um negócio do tipo lanchonete e adquirir uma viatura. Tem como desafios regularizar um espaço para implantar a lanchonete
texts.en: Irene is married and lives with her husband, a son, and four grandchildren. Her husband is a carpenter and she's a laborer. With the current loan she intends to purchase construction supplies in order to build better equipped bathrooms. Her dream is to open a business such as a snack bar and buy a vehicle. Her challenge is legalizing a space where she can set up the snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to build better equipped bathrooms.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина — пенсионерка. Она живет одна, состоит в разводе.  В свое время Галина жила в Чернобыле. Дети были ликвидаторами на ЧАЭС и уже, к сожалению, умерли. Галина осталась практически одна, но нашла женщину, которая согласилась присматривать за ней. У Галины двухкомнатная квартира. Ремонт простой, но нормальный. На кухне она тоже недавно сделала новый ремонт, поставила там металлопластиковое окно. Однако с балкона все равно зимой дует ветер, в квартиру проникает холод и затекает вода, поэтому давно надо что-то предпринять, чтобы улучшить жилищные условия. 
Использовать 6 000 гривен Галина хочет для того, чтобы поставить балконный металлопластиковый блок в квартире, чтобы было тепло и вода не затекала в квартиру.
texts.en: Galina is a pensioner. She lives alone as she is divorced. Previously, Galina lives in Chernobyl. Her children were part of the emergency clean-up team for the Chenobyl Nuclear Power Plant and, unfortunately, they have already died. Galina remains practically alone, but she found a woman who agreed to look after her. Galina lives in a two-bedroom apartment. The renovation on it is simple but adequate. Not long ago, she made renovations to her kitchen by putting in a reinforced plastic window. However, in the winter, the wind blows in all the same from the balcony. The apartment is penetrated by the cold and water flows in through the balcony. This is why she has long-since needed to undertake some measure to improve her living conditions. Galina wants to use 6,000 hryvnia to install a reinforced plastic unit on her apartment balcony so that it will be warm and water won't seep into the apartment.

loans.use: to install a reinforced plastic unit on her apartment balcony so that it will be warm and water won't seep into the apartment.

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en:
Sothy is 45 years old and a married woman with six children. She lives in Bakan District of Pursat Province, which is located in the western part of Cambodia. For the last twenty years, she and her husband have been involved in a rice farming business, growing rice and selling the crop to the local dealers. It is the sole source of their income.

Sothy wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Mechail

texts.en:
Mechail works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Mechail requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her livestock.

She has been in this business for three years now.

Mechail would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for livestock

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and her three children are in school.

Melvin has a native bags-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Melvin would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, cubes, oil, bitter ball, peppers, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, stout, beer, Malta, soft-drink, bread, butter, cream, tissue, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
A sus 47 años de edad la señora María paso por una difícil situación la cual fue perder a su esposo dejándola sola como cabeza de familia y gracias al tiempo compartido con su esposo y al ser una campesina desde su nacimiento saco  la fuerza para comenzar un negocio para no dejar decaer su hogar.

María se dedica a la cría de cerdos y pollos, gracias a esta actividad ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia conformada por dos hijos ofreciéndoles buena alimentación y más que eso se entretiene y despeja su mente ya que siempre tiene presente a su esposo.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de concentrado y cerdos para aumentar sus animales, pues para ella es vital este crédito dado que es madre cabeza de familia y en muchas ocasiones no le queda el capital para invertir en su negocio y más que eso tiene ánimos de progresar y honrar el nombre de su esposo con su negocio.
texts.en:
At 47 years of age, Sra. María went through a difficult situation after the loss of her husband. She was left alone as the leader of her family. Thanks to the time she shared with her husband and having lived in the countryside from the time she was born, María found the strength to start a business so that her household would not go into decline.

María raises pigs and chickens. Thanks to this business, she is able to sustain her family, which includes her two children. As a result, she is able to provide them a good diet. Most of all, this business keeps her busy and helps to clear her mind as if her husband were still present.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy concentrated feed and more pigs so that she can increase her litter. This loan is important to her as a mother and as the head of her family. On many occasions, she does not have the capital to invest in her business. María is eager to make progress and honor the name of her husband with her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as slippers, earrings, and lappas to sell.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a 40-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako.  As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yakubu is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Yakubu is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Esther,  and Uwana. Yakubu’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy trousers and blankets

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 27 year old business woman living in the Shurugwi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothes for women and African printed material for one year now.   She also volunteers as a Community Health Trainer in schools within her community. With the requested loan, Theresa intends to make bulk purchases of clothes of better quality to become more competitive and boost her sales and profit volumes. With additional profits, she hopes to expand into a retail business and create employment for her community and provide for her siblings.

loans.use: to purchase quality clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy footwear, clothing and blankets

loans.name: Yohanna

texts.en: Yohanna is a Babban Gona farmer from Dogon Fako. Yohanna is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Yohanna to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yohanna can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Yohanna is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Yohanna is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Yohanna will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.pt:
O Sr. Jaime de 43 anos de idade casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 2 são independente e vivem nas suas próprias casa, 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primário e secundário e os 2 sem idade para frequentar a escola. Ele é trabalhador na empresa de produção de blocos e venda de material de construção “ BRICON” é tambem agricultor informal, actividade que esta a explorar junto com a sua esposa a mais de 16 anos, seus produtos vende ns sua machamba e nos mercados de Maputo.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar insumos agricola (feijao verde, batata reno, pestecidas) para dar continuidade com a sua actividade e garantir a sua reforma.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação e a dieta alimentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 43 years old and married. He has seven children, two of whom are independent and live in their own houses, three attend primary and secondary school and two are below school age. He works for Bricon, a company that manufactures bricks and sells construction supplies. He's also an informal farmer, a business he has run alongside his wife for over 16 years. He sells his produce at his farm and the markets of Maputo.
The current loan will be used to purchase farming supplies (green beans, potatoes and pesticide) so that he can move forward with his business and do some repair work.
His biggest challenge is improving his family's diet and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies (green beans, potatoes and pesticide).

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mona is 36 years old, and has five children who are currently in school.

Mona has a buy and sell plastic rope business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of plastic rope to sell.

Mona has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of plastic rope to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 49 years old and has four children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Perlita is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

She has been buying and selling livestock for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Perlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 39 years old and married with three children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, noodles, shampoo, milk, juice, etc., to sell.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from poultry.

Merlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items, such as canned goods, soft drinks, cereals, noodles, shampoo, milk, juice, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu is a 38-year-old farmer from Dogon Fako. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yakubu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Yakubu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yakubu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; balarabe, sadic,  and  morat, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods such as meat to sell.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Zimbabwe’s Wedza District resident Patience had a great need to become economically independent, so she started her own clothing business two years ago. Patience sells jackets, shirts, skirts, dresses, shoes, and slippers. Further, Patience volunteers at her former secondary school every week as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills to young students. With the Kiva loan, Patience intends to make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales volumes and profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own shop one day, which will bring stability to her business.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales volumes and profits.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 32 years old and married with two children. With both her children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rosie has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, sugar, coffee, noodles, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. 

Rosie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goods such as milk, corn flakes, butter, sugar and peanut butter, etc.

loans.name: Graciano

texts.pt:
Graciano, casado maritalmente, pai de 4 filhos, dos quais 3 é que frequentam escola em diferentes níveis e vive na casa própria. Para além da sua família sustenta também a sua mãe que não vive junto. 
Deseja reiniciar com actividade comercial comprando e vendendo vestuário. Também é funcionáriO da Tongaat Hulett exercendo as funções de Segurança e a sua esposa apoia na actividade comercial.
Com o presente empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir mais sapatilhas, camisas, vestidos e chinelos para responder a demanda.
Tem como sonhos construir uma casa condigna e sustentar os estudos dos filhos. Tem como principal desafio: a falta de fundos para investir no negócio.
texts.en:
Graciano is married and has four children, three of whom attend various levels of school. He lives in a house that he owns. Aside from his family he also supports his mother, but she doesn't live with him.
He wishes to make a new start with a business buying and selling garments. He also works for Tongaat Hulett as a security guard and his wife supports him in his business endeavors.
With the current loan for 10,000mt he intends to purchase more sandals, shirts, dresses and slippers so he can meet the demand.
His dreams are to build a decent house and support his children in their studies. His main challenge is the lack of funds for investing in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more sandals, shirts, dresses and slippers so he can meet the demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of sugar, cooking oil, and hygiene and cleaning prodcuts.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Miguelina has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

Miguelina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gear for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as fish, pig feet, and bags of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy enough goods (slippers, used clothes, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Luz Isnelda

texts.es:
Luz es una muy trabajadora y honrada mujer del campo que se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y de levante actividad muy variable y difícil de llevar. 

Se enfrente con varias dificultades como lo son hoy en día la desvaloración del costo del litro de leche lo que los ha afectado en gran medida y añadido a esto esté ganado es muy susceptible a enfermedades por lo que hay que estar al día con vacunas y la verdad son muy costosas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra ganado lechero pues por el bajo precio que ya le compran la leche tiene que producir mucho más para mantener los gastos de la finca y tener una buena estabilidad económica de su familia conformada por su esposo, tres hijos y sus padres.

El crédito para ella le servirá mucho pues no solo cubrirá el déficit de producción de leche si no que podrá comprar las costosas vacunas y proteger su preciado y amado ganado de las enfermedades.
texts.en:
Luz is a very hardworking and honest countrywoman, she makes a living raising diary cattle and fattening cattle. It is a very variable and difficult activity to carry out. She faces several difficulties, presently of of them is the devaluation of the cost of a liter of milk, which has affected them greatly. Furthermore, this cattle is very susceptible to diseases and that is why it is necessary to be up to date with their vaccines that, truthfully, are very expensive. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase dairy cattle because due to the low price at which her milk is being purchased, she has to produce much more to be able to keep up with the farm expenses and have good economic stability for her family (her husband, three children, and her parents). 

The loan will help her a lot because it will not only cover the milk’s production deficit, but she will also be able to purchase the expensive vaccines to protect her precious and loved cattle from diseases.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, and vaccines for her cattle

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Isidra is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Isidra has a native bag making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Isidra has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy enough sandals and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Ishaya Danyaro

texts.en: Ishaya Danyaro is a Babban Gona farmer from Auta Makeri. Ishaya Danyaro is driven by one goal: to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Ishaya Danyaro to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Ishaya Danyaro can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Ishaya Danyaro is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 35 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access the required yield enhancing inputs such as improved seeds. Ishaya Danyaro is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland.  Ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Ishaya Danyaro will be able to access all the inputs and services to make these dreams reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Luka Danjuma

texts.en: Luka Danjuma is a 48-year-old farmer from Lumu.  As a Babban Gona member, Luka Danjuma is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Luka Danjuma can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Luka Danjuma is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to access quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Luka Danjuma is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Timoti, and Issuwa. Luka Danjuma’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
A Sra. Gloria de 54 anos de idade casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 são maior de idade e independentes e 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario. Ela è funcionaria Bancaria a mais de 16 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (cimento, blocos, area e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para a construção de um salão de eventos.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação, a dieta alimentar da sua familia e ter mais financiamento na Hluvuku-Adsema.
texts.en:
Gloria is 54 anos, married, and the mother of four children, three of whom are adults living on their own and one of whom is in high school. She has worked in a bank for more than 16 years.
She will use this loan to buy construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, and sand) and pay labor costs to build an event hall.
Her biggest goal is to improve the living conditions and diet of her family and to receive more financing through Hluvuku-Adsema.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, cinder blocks, and sand) and pay labor costs to build an event hall.

loans.name: Almara

texts.en: Almara is 52 years old, and lives in the Sabirabad region of Azerbaijan with four members of her family.  She is running a business selling dresses, long pants, long and short sleeve shirts, and skirts.  She is earning good income selling clothing because she lives in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is open every day.  Now Almara  is applying for a loan of 1,200 AZN to improve her business to buy new clothes.

loans.use: to buy new clothes

loans.name: Bibihadisa

texts.en: Bibihadisa was born in the year 1978. She is a careful mother of five children. Bibihadisa’s husband is a cooker. She is a sewer. Bibihadisa sews national women clothes. She has worked this way for more than five years. She services her clients in her house. Her house is in bad condition. She is going to repair her house and her workshop also. This way she will improve her living and business conditions. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints and etc.

loans.name: Roquesa

texts.en:
Roquesa earns a living from helping her husband with their service-based business. For three years, Roquesa has been earning well and improving the business, and offers vehicle rental in their community to earn extra income. Her earnings go to her children's education costs. 

To maintain better services, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy a new set of tires. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing better education to her children in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase welding equipment, a drill, a grinder, and hand tools.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 51 years old and married with seven children.

Teodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teodora has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Teodora aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en:
Milijana  wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to purchase additional inventory of children's clothes and toys for her store. These purchases have helped her to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family. 

As a continued pursuit to offer her children a better life, she is now asking for a loan once again for her business in order to purchase more items. She hopes that with the income she will be able to save for her children’s education, which will give them more opportunities and a brighter future. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more items

loans.name: Miguel Alfredo

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 62 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, está acompañado y ha procreado 6 hijos que ya son mayores de edad, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, encasa nada mas vive una hija y los demás han formado sus propios hogares. 

Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra maíz y frijol, alquila una hectárea de tierra para poder hacer la siembra, esto lo aprendió solo de ver a su padre cuando salía a trabajar al campo, esta es la única actividad que él realiza, el terreno donde siembra le queda a 30 minutos de su casa y viaja caminando, sale de su casa a las 5:30 de la mañana para trabajar de 6:00 a 11:30 am.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y aplicárselo a la milpa, además pagará el alquiler del terreno y la mano de obra.  

Sus sueños son que Dios le permita tener buena salud, fuerzas para seguir trabajando y que en su casa no falte el sustento diario
texts.en:
Miguel is 62 years old and studied until the 1st grade.  He is in a relationship from which he has 6 children who are now adults.  His life partner is a housekeeper.  Only one of his daughters lives at home and the rest have started homes of their own.  

Miguel makes a living in agriculture.  Farming is his only work, and he learned the trade solely from watching his father go out into the fields to work.  He grows corn and beans on a rented hectare of land.  The land that he cultivates is 30 minutes from his house and he travels there on foot.  He leaves his house at 5:30 in the morning so that he can work from 6:00 to 11:30 A.M.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer and apply it to the corn field, and he will also use it to pay the rent on the land and to pay for labor.

His dreams are that God will grant him good health and strength to keep working, and that his house will not lack daily sustenance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and apply it to his cornfield, as well as to pay rent on the land and pay for labor

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en: Mathias is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Mathias joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his child Magdalin. Mathias is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Mathias will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Mathias can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Mathias said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Mathias is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Markus

texts.en: Markus is a 56-year-old farmer from Auta Makeri.  As a Babban Gona member, Markus, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Markus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s average annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Markus is ambitious and is hoping that as a result of this loan, he will be able to acces quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seeds that will  result in a yield of at least 35 bags of maize per hectare this season.  Markus is hopeful about what the future holds; he  hopes that with the increased income as a result of a high yield, he will finally be able to afford to educate his children; Ishaku,  and  Ibrahim. Markus’s dreams do not end there: “ultimately, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”, he expressed.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double maize yield and income

loans.name: José Anibar

texts.es:
José tiene 47 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, es viudo desde hace unos meses ya que lamentablemente su esposa falleció, con ella procreó 2 hijos de las edades de 19 y 3 años de edad, en su casa solo vive él con sus dos hijos y ninguno se encuentra estudiando.

José se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene cerca de 8 años de realizar esta actividad, él siembra 2 hectáreas de ajonjolí, lo aprendió de su padre, además en sus tiempos libres realiza trabajos ajenos cuando lo buscan. El lugar donde él siembra está a 10 minutos de su casa y trabaja en un horario de 6:00 a 11:30 am y solo su hijo se involucra.


El préstamo lo necesita para comprar una bolsa de abono para aplicarlo a su cultivo, comprará una bomba de riego ya que tiene una tomatera pequeña y necesita regarla.


Sus sueños son que Dios le de salud a sus hijos y a él para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
José is 47 years old and studied up to the second grade. He is a widower as of the last few months since his wife sadly passed away. He had two children with her who are 19 and 3 years old. He lives on his own with his two children, neither or which are in school.

José makes a living farming and has been doing so for about eight years now. He sows two hectares of sesame. He learned this skill from his father. In addition, in his free time he works other jobs when they are offered to him. The land he farms is ten minutes away from his house, and he works from 6am to 11:30am with only the help of his son.

He needs this loan in order to buy a sack of fertilizer to use for his crops and to buy an irrigation pump since he now has a small plot of tomatoes he needs to water. His dream is that God will give give him and his children good health to continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy a sack of fertilizer to use for his crops and to buy an irrigation pump since he now has a small plot of tomatoes he needs to water.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 38 years old. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business. She has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Maria Camila

texts.es:
María aprendió un gran consejo de su madre y es siempre ser emprendedora y generar sus propios recursos por eso desde muy joven comenzó con una tienda naturista, ofreciendo productos para el cuidado del cuerpo y hierbas medicinales 100% naturales.
