Solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio que está viéndose afectado por la difícil competencia en el sector y ha observado que en muchas ocasiones el cliente se deja llevar por el aspecto del local, por tal motivo el crédito será invertido en reformas, compra de vitrinas, estanterías y productos que no se encuentran en otro negocio que oferte productos similares. 

Su sueño es ser la mejor tienda naturista de puerto boyaca y poder empelar muchas personas y colaborar bajando el índice de desempleo en el sector
texts.en:
Maria learned from the great advice of her mother to always be enterprising and to make her own money.  Therefore, when she was very young she started a health food store offering body care products and 100% natural herbal medicines.  

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business that has been affected by the difficult competition in the area.  She has seen that on many occasions customers get caught up in the look of the store, and therefore the loan will be invested in renovations, and the purchase of display cases, shelving units, and products that can't be found in other stores that offer similar products.  Her dream is to be the best health food store in Puerto Bocaya and to be able to employ many people and do her part to lower to unemployment rate in the area.

loans.use: to renovate her store and buy display cases, shelving units, and natural products

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque con su familia. Modesto siempre se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 15 años cultiva café esta producción la vende en pergamino a intermediarios de la zona. Ha invertido varios prestamos a su finca para mantenerla en buen estado, actualmente necesita comprar abono y fertilizantes, para lo cual solicita otro préstamo por 3,500 lempiras, espera seguir dando asistencia y mejorando la producción. Su plan es ampliar el cultivo para darle mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Modesto is 42 years old; he is married, he has three children, and he lives in a village in the municipality of Siguatepeque with his family. 

Modesto has always made a living from the cultivation of corn and beans, and it has been 15 years now since has cultivated coffee. He sells his products through intermediaries nearby. He has invested several loans in his lands to keep it in good shape. Currently, he needs to purchase manure and fertilizers, which is why he is requesting another loan for 3,500 HNL. 

He hopes to keep giving assistance and improving his production. His plan is to expand his crops to give a better life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizers to give assistance to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business weaving native bags in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene 46 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo quienes le apoyan con los oficios del hogar. 


Alejandro  se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, en la producción granos básicos y las hortalizas, esto lo aprendió de su padre y para llegar al lugar donde cultiva tarda 15 minutos a pie.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y fríjol. 


Su sueño es seguir trabajando en el negocio de las hortalizas para seguir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 46 years old and he has a second grade education. He is married and has two children who help him with the household chores. Alejandro works as a farmer, producing staple grains and vegetables, which he learned from his father. It takes him fifteen minutes to walk to work. 

He needs the loan to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans. His dream is to continue working in the vegetable business to move forward with his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, tiene 41 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Tocoa, Colon. En busca de obtener ingresos decidió hace 12 años establecer una pulpería donde vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, carnes, frijoles, productos enlatados, jugos, refrescos, lácteos, pan, churros, etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir su negocio con productos como frijoles, embutidos, churros, refrescos, carnes, arroz, azúcar, productos de limpieza, y otros abarrotes. Su Plan es seguir creciendo con el negocio y que este involucrada su familia.
texts.en:
Dina is 41 years old and lives in a common-law marriage with her husband with whom she has two children.  She lives in Tocoa, Colon.  To make a living, she decided 12 years ago to start a small grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, shortening, flour, meat, beans, canned goods, juice, soft drinks, dairy products, bread, and chips, among other things.  

She has asked for a loan of 20,000 Lempiras to supply her business with products such as beans, sausages, chips, soft drinks, meat, rice, sugar, cleaning products, and other groceries.  

Her plan is to continue growing her business and to get her family involved in it.

loans.use: to supply her business with products such as beans, sausages, chips, soft drinks, meat, rice, sugar, cleaning products, and other groceries

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Juliet, who is aged in her early 70s, is a mother of four grown sons. She is widow since 1991; since then, she has been taking care of her family herself. She is teacher by profession, having a degree from a teaching course, but retired in 1999 as a civil servant. She used her salary to manage the family, but after reaching the age of retiring, she looked for a way to maintain her living. She introduced a few projects to go through. One is a nursery school, since 2002, and a tuition service teaching English and mathematics subjects, a service she has been in since the 1980s. 

She has 30 kids in nursery school and 15 tuition students. She is doing great despite a few uncontrollable challenges: frequently changing teaching books, and every school with its own teaching books. These are so costly to Juliet. 

Juliet has also a poultry (raising local chickens) business and a garden growing vegetables. Juliet runs all these businesses with house-girl support. Working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. each working day, she is able to earn a good profit each month. 

This will be Juliet's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use it to paint her nursery classes and to buy more teaching books to make her tuition classes up to date. She has paid back her loan successfully. She used her profit to cover household expenses. She dreams of improving her school by having a shop selling school items.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Meru," which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to paint nursery classes and buy teaching books.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza was born in the year 1980. She is married and brings up two little children. She lives with her parents in an agricultural region. Local people mainly have been busy with animal husbandry. Nargiza also wants to organize business with animal husbandry. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead’ of the women's organization and got a certificate. She will be a successful business lady, as she is a smart and hardworking woman. Her husband will help her with managing the business. 

She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Amirah

texts.en: Amirah is studying at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. She wants to finish her studies to be able to help her family and herself. She says that she endured whenever she had difficulties at school. Her family at the moment is experiencing financial difficulties; thus she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders. Amirah is very positive that the lenders will grant her loan request for it will be her way to uplift her family’s way of living.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a married woman with 13 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vicenta is 60 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Vicenta has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Vicenta has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Ofelia has engaged in a direct-selling business within her community for years now. She is 53 years of age and blessed with three children. She and her children work hard to provide for their needs.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

Due to financial insufficiency, Ofelia cannot manage to make her business more profitable and earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a hardworking entrepreneur, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Ofelia dreams for her business to grow bigger and hopes to give her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en: Patrocinia , a mother of six, has managed a general store for more than 10 years and earns well to support her family. She has sustained her business with support from her entire family. She wants to save more for her future needs and emergencies and works hard toward that goal. She took out a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

location.town: Mabini Extention, Carmen annex Ozamiz city

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now. Josephine requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and breads for her food production business. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and breads for her food production business

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 41 years old and married. Zenaida works very hard to provide for her family.

Zenaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, soft drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, and beer to sell.

Zenaida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items in her store. 

Zenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, biscuits, soft drinks, cereals, sanitary pads, and beer to sell.

loans.name: Ordinary

texts.en:
Ordinary is a new client to the organization, and he applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings. Ordinary is aged 27 years old, and he is still single. He comes from Buyanja, Rukungiri. He deals in second-hand clothes as his main source of income. 

The purpose of the loan is to add stock in his business, i.e., buying more second-hand clothes for selling. Ordinary is thankful for Ugafode’s financial assistance, which he hopes will contribute to his development and that of his family.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Bahora

texts.en: Bahora is a young and hard-working single woman who lives with her parents. Her parents are poor people. She wants to earn a living and improve her family's living conditions. Bahora is going to start an animal husbandry business. She took part in a course, "To Get Ahead," through a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy cattle for starting her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business weaving native bags in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Vicky requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business weaving native bags.

Vicky would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business weaving native bags

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida works hard to support her family. Zenaida is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Zenaida requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Zenaida has been in this business for eight years now.

Zenaida would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: María, tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, vive con su padre y sus hijos en la aldea de la Flecha, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, le ayudaba a su padre a vender verduras y hace 5 años que es propio. Ella vende yuca, zanahoria, pepino, limones, bananos verdes, tomate, chiles, cebolla, jilote, pataste, ajos, repollo etc. Decidió por solicitar un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para mantener surtido de verduras frescas como tomate, repollo, chile, cebolla, yuca, bananos, jilotes, patastes etc. y poder vender mas. Con las ganancias tiene planes de ampliar el local del negocio y mantenerlo surtido.
texts.en:
Maria is a 23-year-old single mother with two children.  She lives with her father and her children in the small village of La Flecha, Santa Bárbara.  She has always worked in commerce since she started helping her father sell vegetables, and for 5 years they have owned their own business.  

She sells yucca, carrots, cucumbers, lemons, green bananas, tomatoes, chili peppers, onions, young corn, patastes, garlic, and cabbage, among other things.

She decided to ask for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to keep her store supplied with fresh vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbage, chili peppers, onions, yucca, bananas, young corn, and patastes, among other things, and so that she can sell more.   With the profits she plans to enlarge the store and keep it well stocked.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell such as tomatoes, cabbage, chili peppers, onions, yucca, bananas, young corn, and patastes, among other things

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 32-year-old Ugandan who lives in Kenga in the Kagadi district; He is married to Evelyn and they have four children, two attending school.
His main economic activity is farming. He grows maize, coffee beans, and bananas.
Moses has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to hire laborers to clear his land and plant maize and Irish potatoes. 
His plans for the future include educating all his children and acquiring more land for agriculture.

loans.use: to hire labor for his farm.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия работает медсестрой в детском саду в г. Белая Церковь. Она живет в двухкомнатной квартире, которую в свое время помогла ей купить мама. Однако пока еще Наталии не хватало средств закончить там ремонт, так как доходы ее и супруга не очень большие. 
Сумму в 20 000 гривен Наталия хочет использовать для того, чтобы добиться улучшения жилищных условий своей семьи. Она хочет установить межкомнатные двери, положить ламинат, поменять ванну, унитаз, краны и окна.
texts.en: Nataliya works as a nurse in a kindergarten in the city of Belaya Tserkov. She lives in a two-bedroom apartment which her mother previously helped her to buy. However, Nataliya does not yet have enough money to finish renovating the house, as both her and her husband's salaries are not very large. Nataliya wants to use 20,000 hryvnia (UAH) to finish improving her family's living conditions. She wants to put in interior doors, install laminate flooring, and replace the bathtub, toilet, sink and windows.

loans.use: to put in interior doors, install laminate flooring, and replace the bathtub, toilet, sink and windows.

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, Munga has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where his potential customers are town-dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during rainy season when it becomes hard to operate. His dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, Munga wants to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and purchase new spare parts.

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.ru:
Николай — из Хуста. Он уже 3 года занимается торговлей феерверками для свадеб и других торжеств и праздников. Для ведения бизнеса Николай арендует помещение в центре города. Работает сам, наемных рабочих нет. 
Полученные от КИВА средства в размере 30 000 гривен Николай планирует вложить в ремонт своей квартиры. Николай хочет сделать ремонт квартиры с целью в будущем сэкономить средства на счетах по коммунальным услугам, а именно он хочет поставить новые окна и двери, потому что старые пропускают холод, и поменять старую ванну на новую. Мечта Николая — построить собственный дом однажды и устроить будущее своего пока еще маленького сына.
texts.en: Nikolai is from Khoost. For three years now, she has been selling fireworks for weddings and other celebrations and holidays. Nikolai rents a space in the center of the city to run his business. He does all the work himself - he doesn't have any hired workers. With the 30,000 hryvnia (UAH) received from Kiva, Nikolai plans to invest the funds in renovating his apartment. Nikolai wants to renovate his apartment with the goal of being able save money in the future on his utilities. Specifically, he wants to install new windows and doors (as the old ones let in the cold) and replace his old bathtub with a new one. Nikolai's dream is to own home one day and build a future for his still young son.

loans.use: to install new windows and doors and to buy a new bathtub.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline has been selling a variety of grocery goods in her village, aside from her farm. She also supplies fruits and vegetables in the market, which she acquired from her husband's farm and from their neighbor. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. 

Evangeline hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана — из Мелитополя. Она торгует кондитерскими изделиями на местном рынке. У нее есть своя торговая точка. Светлана — замужем, у нее двое взрослых детей — сын и дочь. Светлана любит свое дело и буквально живет им.
На 25 000 гривен Светлана планирует закупить дополнительную партию товара и увеличить свой продуктовый ассортимент. Полученные от реализации новой партии товара средства Светлана намерена вложить в последующее развитие своего бизнеса и увеличение оборота продаж.
texts.en: Svetlana is from Melitopol. She sells candy at the local market. She has her own selling stall. Svetlana is married and has two grown-up children - a son and a daughter. Svetlana loves her work and literally lives off of it. Svetlana plans to use 25,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy an additional shipment of merchandise, thus increasing her stall's variety of goods. Svetlana plans to invest the earnings from the sales of the new shipment of merchandise in the further development of her business and increase in her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase an additional shipment of merchandise.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia owns and operates a tricycle unit. She has been successful in this business for years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income to provide for their everyday needs and necessities.

Relative to this, she would like to take a new loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle. She is requesting an amount of PHP 15,000 for the maintenance of the tricycle and to pay for the renewal of the franchise agreement/permit so she can continue her business operation.

In the future, Eufemia hopes to grow and expand her business. She dreams of abundance and a healthy life for her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rhodora hopes to increase her profits from the business. She also dreams for her children to finish their degrees in college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Alma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business.

Alma has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock and supplies for her business

loans.name: Ortikjon

texts.en: Ortikjon is married and has 2 children. She lives with her parents in a rural area. Ortukjon is a careful mother of 2 children. She decided to start a new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.  She studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization and received enough business skills. Her children will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan of 3500 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.en: Hurmatoy was born in 1968. She lives in Tajikistan with her son, daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren. Hurmatoy is widowed. Her husband died some years ago. She is going to start her own animal husbandry business and in this way help her son with providing the family with all of the necessary things. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 600 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing the new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle for starting a new business

loans.name: Emielou

texts.en:
Emielou is 23 years old, married and lives in Canlambo, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she decided to raise pigs in her own backyard.
 
Through Paglaum PC she obtained the capital to purchase her piglets and feeds. Now, she requests a loan of 6,000.00 PHP to buy additional feeds. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and hogs for raising

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is 45 years old and from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is married with 3 children. His wife is an overseas Filipino Worker. What they earn is sometimes not enough for them. To send their son, Alec Sheen to college, they would like to seek financial assistance from KIVA lenders. Leonardo is asking for Php 10,000 to pay for his son’s tuition fee. Leonardo said that his son is very determined to finish his studies that is why he is working hard to send him to college.

loans.use: To pay for his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: While her husband does farming, their main source of income, Eva find her own way to earn an income to help the family. She prepares and cooks coco balls, one of the children's favorite foods in their village. She sells it in school and makes some displays in the neighbor's store as consignment. To offer more, she requested a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare coco balls in order to supply more stores in her village. Hoping to augment their living, Eva joined GDMPC, and because of this her plan for improving the business has become easier.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare coco balls in order to supply more stores in her village

loans.name: Anafel

texts.en:
Anafel is 54 years old and married, with one child. With one child still in school, Anafel works very hard to provide for the family.

Anafel runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Anafel has been in this business for 12 years and she sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, bath soap, detergent soap, and candies. 

Anafel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu appreciates the support of the previous loan, which helped her to boost her business. She has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Saumu dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar panel to setup electricity for her family

loans.name: Ignatious

texts.en:
Ignatious is a 40-year-old male Ugandan married with 3 children aged 12, 10 and 6, and all 3 of them attend school.

He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise but he also does farming though on a small scale. He has been doing these since 2008.

He has applied for a loan of ugx. 2,000,000= to reinvest in his shop to get better returns. He will buy corn flour, sugar, soap, rice and other household  items. 

He has been challenged however by competition from other people with similar businesses. He will be able to gradually outcompete them if he keeps getting financial support.

loans.use: To buy corn flour, rice, soap, sugar and other items to sell in a retail shop

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 32-year-old woman married to Alexander who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with three children. 

Florence operates a cosmetics shop alongside a clothing sales shop, which has been in operation for seven years, earning her an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Florence is now servicing her 2nd loan of KES.30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy perfumes, jewelry, hair braids, weaves and a sewing machine. Florence plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and open another clothing business shop in the nearby town, and she hopes to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, jewelry, hair braids, weaves, body lotions and creams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Edy

texts.en: Edy is engaged in the farming business, which is growing rice in their field. He is married and blessed with three children. Two of his children are in college while the youngest is in elementary school. Edy’s wife is a housekeeper. They don’t have other sources of income aside from farming. Edy admits that sometimes he finds difficulty in sending his children to school but he is doing his best to provide for a better future for his children. As he believes that learning is something that no one can take away from you. With regards to his farming business, Edy is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm. He hopes that someday he will successfully finish sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She has boosted her income and has also improved their general living condition.

Mercidita would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies such as wires and baskets, as well as supplies such as seeds and fertilizers needed in her business. She is requesting an amount of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and various hanging plants.

In the future, Mercidita desires to expand her ornamental business. She also dreams of a better, peaceful and abundant life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their lives and business every week. There she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and talk about microfinance.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Esthern

texts.en:
Esthern is 31 years old, married to Philip and blessed with three children. She has been running a private school for the last five years and earns a monthly income of KES.10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
She has applied for her second loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more desks for the classroom.                                                                                           

The profits will be used to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and expand the school up to secondary.

loans.use: to buy more desks for the classrooms

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Geraldine is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Geraldine has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ngy's Group

texts.en: Ngy is 54 years old and married. She is a mother of nine children. Her family resides in Kampong Cham provice where she farms rice and cassava. To supplement the family’s income, her husband is a house builder. Now, Ngy wants to focus on solar energy in her household. Therefore, she requests a new loan to buy solar lighting. She hopes that she can have solar electricity which will save more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy solar lighting for her home

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is 52 years old and married with 7 children. He works as a laborer while his spouse is a housewife. What he earns is not enough for all of the family’s expenses. To help him send his son Joel to school, he wants to obtain a Php 10,000 loan from KIVA lenders. Joel is 17 years old and is taking up Automotive training. He wants to finish college to find a job and help his family.

loans.use: To pay for his son's tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for the labor cost.

loans.name: Adresita

texts.en: Adresita manages her piggery business to make a living, which she has been doing for more than seven years. She earns a good living from this business and wants to expand it. Aside from this, she also runs a general store which gives better cash inflows for the family. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying piglets. Improving her business is easier with her access to microfinance services from GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to live with her family with improved living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Reyno

texts.en: Reyno is 53 years of age; he is from Paniqui, Tarlac. His son, Reineil, is studying in St. Paul Colleges Foundation. Reyno’s earnings are not enough to fund Reineil’s college education; thus he wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 from the KIVA lenders. He is hopeful that the lenders will approve his loan.

loans.use: To pay for his son's tuition fee.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina has been cultivating coconuts for many years to sustain the family. With the help of the entire family, she was able to improve the farm in an easier way. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. She always finds ways to keep going with her goal of improving their lives. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for weeding maintenance costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and to pay for weeding maintenance costs

loans.name: Irish

texts.en: Irish has been selling their farm products like copra and corn in town aside from her husband's income from driving. Her children are going to study in the elementary grades, and she has to earn income for their needs. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Irish hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming corn for six years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal, aged 29, is married with three children aged between 9 months and 8 years. Two of them go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has spent eight years in the business. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 34 years old with five children aged between 2 and 15; four of them go to school. For the past 5 years, she has run her business with her husband, selling foodstuffs. With the loan, they would like to buy more foodstuffs such as maize flour and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more merchandise to existing sales, such as sugar, maize flour, salt, rice, and sorghum.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale such as potatoes and maize flour.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 34 years old, married to Mary, and blessed with two children aged eight and two years old.

He has been in the carpentry business, whereby he makes different type of furniture for sale to his customers for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 21,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
	 
He has applied for his fourth loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy one full truck of timber for the business.                                                                                          

The anticipated profit he will use to add more timber and carpentry machines.He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy one full truck of timber for sale.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a 53-year-old man, married to Magdalene, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with seven children.  Gregory has been a farmer for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Gregory was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use this amount to buy seedlings and fertilizers for his farm produce.  Gregory plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to become a dairy farmer with a bright future and successful life.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old, single, Palestinian refugee, who works hard to support three other members of his family to cover their living expenses. 

Ahmad sells candies, sweets, and chips through his van, which he uses to pass through several nearby villages to sell his products.
A year ago, he started this business and he is working hard to support it and increase his business capital through acquired loans from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development.

Ahmad is well-known in his region for the special kind of products he sells, with encouraging prices. His business is going fine, but he needs additional cash to increase his capital since he has to take care of three members of his family. 

For this reason, Ahmad is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase his business merchandise with special offer products that will increase his net profit and develop both his business and his family's standard of living.

He hopes to keep expanding his business and increasing its capital in a well-managed way.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special offer products.

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is taking up the study of hospitality and restaurant services. She has two siblings, and her mother is a single parent. She believes, "If you want to finish studying, you can do anything for it even if you struggle financially.”

To help her mother finance her tuition fees, Dave is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 from KIVA lenders. She is very positive that lenders will approve her requested amount for it will really help her to continue her studies.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe  owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than three years and she earns better income from this. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan, used for improving the business. 

To increase sales, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell.   She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Vicenta María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bachillero, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Vicenta, tiene 52 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años de edad el cual este año termina sus estudios del colegio. 
Doña Vicenta con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende zapatillas por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Es así como ella puede ganar algo para que a su hijo pueda seguir con sus estudios que para ella es lo más importantes. Lleva 3 años con su negocio.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatillas de todo tipo. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un buen profesional.
texts.en: The Credit Group Bachillero meets up every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This is a place known to be very dynamic where most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and animal husbandry because it is an area of great vegetation. Vicenta, 52 years old, lives here. She is a single mother of a 17 year old son who will finish his school studies this year. With the intention of earning some money of her own and move ahead, she sells tennis shoes by catalog. Her way of sale is door to door and also at her home, where her better known customers come. This is how she can earn some money so that her son can continue his studies, which is for her the most important thing. She has been working 3 years in this business. She will use this loan to buy tennis shoes of all types. From the beginning she has been in this Credit Group, and she likes it because with the loans she finances her business better. Her dream is that her son becomes a good professional.

loans.use: To buy tennis shoes of all types.

loans.name: Leevi May

texts.en:
Leevi May is 22 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Leevi May has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use:
to take advantage of the roadside location of her house to establish a small restaurant.  She will buy tables, chairs, and bamboo for the local-style construction of the restaurant and ingredients for food preparation.  

mesas- sillas- caña de bambú para la construcción típica del local y otros ingredientes para la preparación de alimentos

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a 35-year-old male Ugandan, married to Sulait. They have 3 children and two attend school.

Haruna operates a restaurant and also is a butcher man as his main businesses since 2009.

Haruna has applied for a loan of 1,000,000= to buy cattle for slaughtering. His dream for the future is to construct a residential house because he is still renting.

His main challenge is lack of enough capital to invest. He is grateful for the financial support to him and his community.

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughter

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
WONDERFUL KIVA LENDERS! Meet Evans, an ambitious, hardworking and go-getting man who is 27 years of age. He hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for many Kenyan Olympic runners and also is home to world record holders in athletics. Evans is still a single man, and he wants to lay a good foundation for his future family, which is why he started farming 3 years ago and has been making and earning a decent  income. Evans practices mixed farming, which is crop and dairy farming and through the two efforts he has been able to support his parents and also provide the basic needs that he requires.

Eldoret area is a very populated area, and Evans has been selling vegetables, milk and fruit to the nearby market. One challenge that is holding him back is the timely delivery of the product to the market. Milk and vegetables are very perishable and require timely delivery so that they can fetch a high price but this is hampered because the road network is poor and also the feeder roads are poor thereby leading to delays in the delivery of product. Because of the above reason, Evans has been having losses because the products reach the market when they are no longer fresh. Therefore, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Through the motorbike he will be able to deliver the products on time to the market and be able to satisfy the increasing client base and market.

Evans is an ambitious person and knowing that there are institutions such as Kiva that help young and enterprising people he feels relieved and knows that he will achieve all of his goals and desires.

Through the loan, Evans will also impact the life of another person because he will employ someone to ride the motorbike and help him with the farm work. Evans has learned a saving culture, and his plans for the extra income he will be getting are to help improve his living standards and also help his parents.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania is a 41-year-old married mother of three, who works hard with her beloved husband to provide their children with a better living and education.
Dania is a hard-working teacher, who works on providing the best education to others since twenty years ago. She has a very good reputation in her region and work place.

Her combined income with her husband's limited monthly salary, aren't enough to cover their necessary increasing living needs. That's why she asked for Al Majmoua's, Kiva's field partner, support through an acquired loan, which will be invested in buying the requested furniture for her children's room, to provide them with a healthy living place.

She is working hard on developing herself in her job to acquire higher degrees, which will support her in increasing her salary in the future.

loans.use: To buy the requested furniture for her children's room

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma owns a snack vending business and sells snacks like pancakes and banana cue. For many years in this business, she was able to support the needs of her family. She successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying raw ingredients. She plans to prepare more snacks to deliver in the villages as consignment. With this, she took a new loan to purchase more ingredients to produce more snacks to sell. In the future, Emma hopes to have more products to sell and have her own snack store.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to produce and sell more snacks

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline helps her husband in managing their own transportation services business to earn a living. Aside from their motorcycle business, Adeline has her buy and sell business, and she earns an extra income from it. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loans used for the business. She had planned to improve the services and maintain safety of their business. 

Recently, she took a new loan to new set of tires in order to replace the old used one.

She is hopeful of saving more from their profit to pursue their plan of buying another motorcycle in the future for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Shierly

texts.en:
Shierly owns and operates an ornamental plant business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for years, and she was able to repay her previous loan. She also has found ways to boost her income by managing a farm and also through maintaining a jeepney (public transport) business.

Shierly would like to take out a new loan to buy additional gardening materials and supplies. She is requesting an amount of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy greater quantities and varieties of ornamental plants such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias, and various hanging plants.

In the future, Shierly desires to grow her business and she also hopes that her children will be able to finish from their schooling. As a CCT community partner, she attends the group's weekly fellowship* meetings, where she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets as well as supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emerliza

texts.en:
Emerliza owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting pineapple and other fruits for sale. She earns well from her investments. She is able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. 

Emerliza wants to improve her farm to ensure a better and greener farm. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time PHP 19,000, to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Emerliza hopes to see improvement in her business and in her life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adelina is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a fishing/fish-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, etc., for her business.

Adelina has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, etc., for her business

loans.name: Faice

texts.en:
Faice is 60 years old with eight children, aged between 22 and 30. Two of them go to school. Others have completed their high school study. 

Faice and her husband have been running the same business, selling foodstuffs, for the past 15 years. With the loan, they would like to buy more sorghum, rice, and beans for resale. 

The profits from the business will be used to set up a studio for photography, which they have realized will have a good return in the future.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, rice, and beans for resale

loans.name: Vattanak

texts.en:
Vattanak lives in a rural area of Banon district of Battambang province. She is 46 years old and she has three children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

To make a living, Vattanak has been farming rice, and growing corn and sesame for 28 years.

Vattanak is just with VisionFund Cambodia for this cycle. Now, she is applying for a loan to pay her son’s tuition fee at the university. She hopes to keep him there until his graduation.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition fee at the university.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en: Boaz is 27 years old, married to Emily, with three children ages 2, 6, and 9; two of his children attend school. He has been a produce dealer since 2009, but he also does farming on a small scale. He has applied for a loan of ugx.1,000,000 to hire labour to support harvesting of his maize, and also to buy seedlings for the new season. His major challenge is the unpredictable changes. He is however grateful to the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: To hire labour for harvesting

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 32-year-old married mother of two, whom she works hard next to her beloved husband in providing them with the necessary living needs. Her low income business combined with her husband's limited monthly salary aren't enough for covering their family's increasing living needs, although her children are enrolled in a public school.

Abir has prepared fishing nets for twenty years; she has a long and wide experience in this domain, which provided her with special talents and customers' trust in this domain, which made her start her own business in 2004. Abir used to work with her parents in this domain, when she had to quit school during elementary stages, to support her parents in their business for better production.

Today Abir is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary business tools to make her work easier, in addition to covering necessary family living needs.

She hopes that in the future she can open a special fishing nets sales shop, and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for her fishing business

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela has been working on their own farm for a living. She has been doing this for many years, with the help of the entire family. Their farm is doing well, and she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. Improving their living becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. 

To improve her farm, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her farm to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 52-year-old woman married to James, who adds additional income to their family. They are blessed with four children.  Jane has been a dry cleaner, or laundry businesswoman, alongside practicing the farming business as a secondary business for seven years, earning an income of KES. 15,000 at the end of every month.

Jane was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor, and is now servicing her first loan of KES.20,000. She intends to use the entire amount to buy an iron box and build an inbuilt wall wardrobes/closets to hang the customers clothes after the laundry work.

Jane plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children, and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy an additional iron box and build an inbuilt wall wardrobes or closets.

loans.name: Ma. Lucena

texts.en:
Ma. Lucena offers manicures and pedicures to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for almost six years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by buying and selling frozen goods. She also manage an e-loading business (prepaid mobile phone load).

For these businesses, she would like to take a new loan to improve her service. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy more nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters, and other materials needed in her business. A portion of the loan will also be used to purchase frozen food products.

In the future, Ma. Lucena hopes to gain more customers. She also dreams to start up other business as additional sources of income, for she desires to always help in providing their needs. Every week she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a barber shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Amy is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her barber shop.

Amy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her barber shop.

loans.name: Ma. Rosabelle

texts.en:
Ma. Rosabelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Ma. Rosabelle successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ma. Rosabelle's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Everest

texts.en:
Everest is a 34 year old Ugandan. He has a wife with whom they have two children aged three and seven with one attending school. They are residents of Busirabo.

His main source of income is the sale of locally processed brew from banana juice. He also farms and operates a pork eating area to supplement his meager income so that he can adequately provide for his family.

He has applied for a loan of 4,000,000 UGX to buy local brew for sale. He is sure he will get profits because the brew is cheap and therefore affordable for the local people. He is however challenged by limited capital to invest in his business and also price fluctuations.

His plans for the future is to construct a good family house. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to buy local beer to sell.

loans.name: Jarbet

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Jarbet who lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, also known as the Home of Champions because of producing so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. She is a mother of five lovely and adorable children that she really treasures and values. She is 53 years of age and has been practicing farming for the last 30 years. Over those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Jarbet is a very dedicated farmer who has been practicing mixed farming and has been able to support her family and take her children to school. Although she has been making a profit, not everything has been good for this enterprising mother. She wants to start poultry farming and take advantage of the ready market for poultry products that is already there in his village.

Jarbet has a never-say-die attitude and has always had challenges accessing funds but she now feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva help enterprising women like her. Jarbet has learned the saving culture and she is sure that with the increased income from selling eggs and poultry products, she will be able to open a large business where she will be selling poultry feed and also poultry products. Jarbet's dream is to get out of the poverty levels and this loan will be a stepping stone towards realizing her dream of improving her living condition and securing the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a male Ugandan, 42 years old and married to Evas. They have five children between 17 and 6 years old. Only four of the children attend school.

Milton is a businessman who operates a retail shop and he owns a maize-milling machine for additional income.

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy stock of daily household use items such as sugar, salt, bread, corn flour, and rice among other items. He has promised to pay on time since his shop will make a profit once he has the capital he requires.

His plan for the future is to expand his shop in to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, corn flour, and rice to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en: Jean Damascene is 34 years old; he is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 15. Four of them go to school. He sells foodstuffs, and has spent five years in the business. With the loan, he would like to buy more sugar, rice, maize flour, beans, and groundnuts for resale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Thess Group

texts.en:
Cristeta is the featured borrower for Thess' group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have been neighbors and friends since they came from the Philippines to work in Lebanon. Cristeta is the first lady at the far left side of the picture wearing an orange top. She works as a housekeeper, like almost all of the Philippine citizens working in Lebanon.

Cristeta is a 56-year-old widowed mother of two. She works hard to provide for her children with a good, healthy living. Her own aim is to fulfill their needs and she hopes that one day they turn into celebrities in the future. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, in  order to send money to her family in the Philippines to pay necessary increasing school tuition fees.

She is looking forward to uniting back with her beloved family.

As for the other group members, Leticia is the lady at the far right side of the picture wearing a green dress and Rubydel is the lady at the center of the picture.

All three of these women wish to be financially capable of going back and spending valuable time with their families.

loans.use: to pay the increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Souheir

texts.en:
Souheir is a 29-year-old married mother of one who works hard with her husband to improve their family's living. She has worked for four years as an accountant in a company specialized in a heaters business. Her low income combined with her husband's limited salary aren't enough to cover their increasing living needs. 

She puts so much effort to provide her beloved son the best education, but it is very expensive in Lebanon to provide a good education for good prices. Thus, for this reason, Souheir is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her child's increasing school tuition fees.

She hopes to stay capable of providing him with the best education and living for a better, brighter future.

loans.use: To pay for her child's increasing school tuition fees

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of bananas and charcoal business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal and bananas to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Teresita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Teresita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ezekiah

texts.en:
Kiva Lenders! Meet Ezekiah, a 31-year old hardworking, very ambitious and enterprising farmer from Eldoret, Kenya, which is home to the best marathon and Olympic runners who have broken world records. He is a proud father of three lovely children that he really loves and treasures. Ezekiah has been  farming for the past seven years, however, he is more interested with dairy farming and he loves his dairy cow and has even nicknamed his animal “Jesimat." Through profits from dairy farming he has been able to take care of his family and pay tuition fees for his school going children. Ezekiah is very appreciative of the fact that milk prices in Eldoret region are high and this enables him to enjoy a good profit margin. Although he has been making profits, he has a challenge of feeding his cows. This is why he is seeking a loan to buy a chuff cutter. This will assist in cutting hay into smaller pieces, aiding in digestion and preventing animals from rejecting any part of their food. Through the loan Ezekiah will be assured of a maximum production of milk from his cows and therefore increased profits. Ezekiah believes that the key to increased milk production is proper food and through the loan he will be assured of that.

Ezekiah plans to save more and buy more dairy cows so as to satisfy the client base and market that is already in his area.

loans.use: to buy a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 36 years old and a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Marissa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a 18,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
HELLO! Meet Nancy, an ever smiling, hardworking, and honest mother who is 26 years of age. She hails from the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University, and also home to the best athletes in the world. She is a proud mother of three lovely school-going children that she really values and treasures and will go an extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Nancy's primary source of income has been milk selling, crop farming, and poultry farming; through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been practicing farming for five years, and through those years she has never regretted venturing into farming.

Nancy sells her products to the nearby market; that is vegetables, eggs, and milk. She has a challenge of timely delivery of the products and also meeting the demand that exists. She is always forced to walk for long distances to reach the market, and this really affects her. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike.

Through the loan she will be able to timely deliver her products, and because her products are perishable, they require quick delivery and the motorbike will offer that.

Nancys dream is to get out of the poverty levels, and she is sure that through this loan she will be able to realize her dream.

She will like to empower others economically, and she plans to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farming activities and through this she will improve her living standards. Through the saving culture that Nancy has, she believes that she will repay the loan and increase her business of farming.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bachillero, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas de 16 y 15 años que estudian en colegio. El marido es oficial de un bus de transporte.
Doña Rosa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de zapatillas y zapatos por catalogo. Su forma de venta es ir a ofrecer con su revista y luego cuando ya tenga varios pedidos envía el pedido el mismo que le llega al otro día y luego se encarga de entregar, estos productos los deja a crédito y cobra cada 15 días. Lleva casi dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito es para comprar zapatillas, zapatos y sandalias de temporada. Lleva dos años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bachillero meets biweekly in the city of Tosagua, which is known for being a very dynamic town. Most of its residents work farming and raising animals because there is a lot of vegetation in the area. 

That is where Rosa lives. She is 29 years old and is in a common law marriage. She has two daughters from this relationship, who are ages fifteen and sixteen. They are both in school. Her husband is a bus driver.

Rosa is a homemaker, but in order to generate her own resources and in turn help out her husband with household expenses, she also works selling slippers and shoes by catalog. Her sales method is going out to offer her magazine and ordering the merchandise whenever she gets several orders. It arrives the next day and then she delivers the products on credit and collects payments biweekly. She has been in business for almost two years, and she started out with the first loan she obtained from the group.

She will use this loan to buy slippers, shoes, and seasonal sandals. She has been a member of her communal bank for two years and enjoys it because the loans allowed her to start her business. Her goal is to keep the business going.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Yanet

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.

Desde hace 4 años se viene dedicando a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar de marcas muy reconocidas.
Inicio gracias a una amiga que le hablo acerca del negocio y le dio unos pequeños pasos para comenzar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina que le permita exhibir sus productos y adicionalmente para la compra de surtido de mercancía para su negocio.

Esto le permitirá atender a sus clientes de una mejor manera y aumentara sus ventas de una manera significativa.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Maria is an enterprising woman who has the drive to move forward and make progress. For the past four years, she has been selling products through catalogs including clothes, accessories, beauty products, and household goods from well-known brands. She began this venture thanks to a friend who talked about the business with her and gave her a few small suggestions on how to get started.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy a display cabinet for exhibiting her products. In addition, she will buy a stock of merchandise for her business. This will enable her to serve her customers in a better way and increase her sales significantly. Maria is hopeful about getting ahead thanks to good-hearted people who support these types of projects.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Esther Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bachillero, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Esther, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tuvieron 2 hijas,  una mayor de edad y la menor de 17 años que estudia en colegio, ambas viven en su casa.
Doña Esther para ganar algo por su cuenta y así lograr sacar adelante a sus hijas se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos, actualmente tiene 20 chanchos y más de 150 pollos en un corral en su casa, ella los alimenta por un buen tiempo  y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos. Es así como ella se ha ganado la vida durante muchos años.
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para chanchos y pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud y darle lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Bachillero meets biweekly in the city of Tosagua, which is known for being a very dynamic town. Most of its residents work farming and raising animals because there is a lot of vegetation in the area.

That is where Esther lives. She is 55 years old and is a widow, since her husband passed away several years ago. She has two daughters from this relationship. One of them is an adult and the youngest is seventeen and is still in school. They both live at home.

In order to make her own income so that she can support her daughters, Esther works raising pigs and chickens. She currently has twenty pigs and over 150 chickens in a pen at home. She feeds them for quite some time before turning them over to sellers that come to her house to buy her animals. That is how she has made a living for many years.

She will use this loan to buy food and medicine for her pigs and chickens. She has been a member of her communal bank from the start and enjoys it because the loans are of great help for her to get ahead. Her hope is to be in good health and provide for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy food and medicine for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Lucia Piedad

texts.es: Piedad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad que va a ingresar a la escuela, ella vive en la casa con sus padres y una hermana, ella los fines de semana  comercializa ganado y los demás  días de la semana trabaja al jornal, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de toretes para incrementar su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos con los que espera educar y formar a su hijo.
texts.en: Piedad is a single mother. She has a four-year-old son who is about to start school. She lives at home with her parents and a sister. She works as a laborer during the week, and on the weekends she sells livestock. She will invest this loan in purchasing young bulls in order to increase business and in turn improve her income, which she hopes to use towards her son's education.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Ligia Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Bachillero, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ligia, tiene 29 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 4 años que estudian en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en servicios varios.
Doña Ligia para ganar algo por su cuenta para beneficio de su hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, por temporada tiene hasta 200 pollos en un galpón en su casa ya que cuenta con el espacio suficiente, ella los alimenta por tres meses y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa a comprar sus animalitos para llevarlos a los mercados de la ciudad y la provincia, lleva más de tres años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para los pollos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para salir adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Credito Bachillero members meet every fifteen days in the city of Tosagua. This place is known to be very dynamic.
